text: OMG, I have a new love in my life and we met at Bistro La Bon!   Too bad we can only see each other on Sundays--but it's worth the wait.  Yes, I've been totally smitten with the chocolate waffles served at Sunday brunch.  This is not to diminish the  wonderfulness of the other items served, but this is like eating chocolate air further indulged with chocolate sauce and whipped cream.  I ate mine at the end of the meal as sort of a dessert, however, it's not nearly as sweet as it sounds,.  Other items I found delectable were the Swedish Meatballs, the Mozzarella Pinwheels and the Silver Dollar Biscuits.  There was a great selection of items on the buffet with plenty of options for vegetarians as well.    I'll definitely return for a rendezvous with my new love!  I'll make a reservation next time--I was lucky to get a table right at noon without one this time.  As it grows in popularity, which I'm sure it will,  reservations will be a must at prime time.  Luckily they do serve until 3 pm for those who might want to dine when it's less crowded.

So, a friend calls me up on a Saturday night and asks if I want to go to brunch at Bistro La Bon.  Being the picky eater that I am I had to check out the menu first before I could commit.  The menu looked doable so I told her sure.    The next day I'm driving to the restaurant and my GPS leads me into a strip mall and I said this can't be right.  With a name like Bistro La Bon I'm expecting valet parking and some ritzy, exclusive location.  I pull into a parking spot to check the address again and realize that I am where I am supposed to be.  I look up and see that the restaurant is at the end of the strip mall by the Family Dollar.  Obviously, I'm thinking where in the heck has my friend brought me.  I walked inside and was pleasantly surprised.  The decor was warm and inviting and the place was packed.    My friend and I were lead to our table and our server explains that we can get food from the buffet as well as order food from the kitchen.  I went to the buffet and ended up with a plate of 4 or 5 grapes and 2 pieces of pineapple.  I had no idea what the other stuff was and I wasn't about to find out.  So, I ordered some eggs, bacon and brioche french toast from the kitchen.  Thank goodness the french toast was included in the buffet price because I got not 1, not 2, but 3 orders.  I'm not the type of person that over eats but I simply couldn't stop.  If I hadn't of felt my pants tightening around my stomach I probably would've gotten another order.    To sum my experience up, the buffet was a little pricey at $20 not including any drinks but the service was great and that french toast is palette blowing.  I will definitely be going back and next time I'll be wearing a dress or sweat pants.

I love the food, service, drinks and atmosphere.  The bar seems to get backed up at bit, according to the dining room staff, and the noise level is very high if you're around large tables.  Our first visit was wonderful.  Our second visit, we were not able to converse, and the bar was backed up, so by the time my wine came, I really didn't want it any longer.

I gave this place 5 stars before I ever ate there and then some Yelper reported me to the Yelp police and my review was removed.  Geesh - people are so serious.  OK, so now I've been there almost 10 times (or have I?) and I can officially say it deserves 5 stars.  Yes, every item on the brunch buffet is great and their bread pudding might be the most incredible dessert ever.  It's also a really cool place to hang out (good bar and drink choices, comfy couches).  The hostesses and bartenders are super nice.  I like to tell my South Charlotte friends how great it is and then watch them wet their pants when they see where it's located (in a strip mall next to a Family Dollar).  But they all recognize the greatness and location quickly becomes a non-issue.  If this place were to ever shut down, I would die.

Our party of four had dinner here on Friday night for the first time and it was,  hands down, the worst dining experience I have had.  The service was terrible!  When we first sat down we ordered cocktails,  which didn't come out until 30 minutes later, and were brought out one at a time, several minutes apart. The food was brought to the table with no plates. Our water glasses were not refilled. The rice and seafood dish was not edible. After ordering a second round of cocktails thst never came despite asking our waiter several times,  we canceled our order and left. We will never go back.

Went for Sunday brunch.  Very good! A Buffett plus the chef sends out kitchen specialties like chocolate waffles.  Bacon and eggs.  Eggs Benedict.  Bit pricy but I think it's worth it.  A family of 4 can easily spend 100 dollars for brunch.

After hearing rave reviews about this place I was not impressed, and down right angry when I left.   Trying it out for their Saturday brunch, I experienced the following:  - inside was cold to the point that all the patrons were wearing their coats inside. - Ordered food and drinks at the same time, but the food arrived before the drinks. - When the food arrived, it was incorrect and left one dish to get cold while the other was being corrected. The dish that was left was not even "complete" according to the waiter.  - Seeing that my wife was pregnant, we ordered two Bloody Marys, one virgin and one not. Well guess who received the virgin and who received the one with alcohol? - Lastly, the food was not even that good. Examples were an omelet that could have passed as a salt lick and grits that were so under-cooked that they were hard.  The only saving grace was a pleasant waiter. It is just unfortunate that he was apparently short changed by the others players at the establishment.

My review is for brunch only - that's all I've had there. But the brunch is fantastic! They have a buffet that has some great stuff, but is not overwhelming. They had everything from salad items, to an olive / pickle mix, roast, Swedish meatballs, (and there is lingonberry sauce!), and some desserty type items, like mini muffins, pastries, and my favorite, the warm coconut macroons. In addition to the all you can eat buffet, you can order from the kitchen items that include brioche French toast (my husband declared this the best French toast he's ever had), eggs with bacon, and chocolate waffles. I thought the chocolate waffles would be waffles that have chocolate drizzled on them, and they did, but they were oh so much more! The waffles themselves were chocolate, and the dollop of whipped cream had chocolate in it. They were delicious!  The service was great. Our coffees and waters were kept constantly filled, and what we ordered from the kitchen came in minutes.  I think for the 2 of us that the bill came to about $38. Which for an all you can eat brunch buffet is not bad at all.  We made reservations (there were 4 of us), and when I made them on Friday afternoon, the only times left were 10 AM or 1:30 PM. We took 10 AM, since 1:30 seemed late for a brunch. It was quiet when we got there, but not empty. We took our  time, and by the time we left at about 12:15, the place was pretty boisterous. I would recommend making reservations, especially if you plan to get there after 11. If you get there before 11, then I think you won't have a problem.

No amount of good food could make up for the debacle that was La Bon Bistro's free lunch buffet.  I know, I know, the first thing you're gonna say is, "Hey, it's free so what do you expect?"  If the whole point is for me to come back and actually spend my pennies at their establishment, I expect at least good to excellent.    So here it is.  My friend and I went to La Bon hoping to get a sample of their free buffet.  I've never been here and love coming across new places to try.  The buffet started at 11:30am, my friend and I arrived at 11:15am and there was already a small line.  No problem since I knew I wasn't the only one to get the memo.  However, I guess I didn't get the memo about making a reservation to this free buffet, neither did 99% of the people waiting in line.  I found the fact that you could even make a reservation to an event like this odd to say the least.  The restaurant was already full by the time we got there.  Anyway, since most of the people in line did not make a reservation they either left or put their name on a waiting list to get inside; the wait, I was told, was an hour.  We decided we'd wait (since I'd driven all the way from Monroe, NC, but little did we know we had a special wait.  Get this, two parties that arrived AFTER us were seated BEFORE us because they were trying to seat us at a table for the baby.  Oh I didn't mention that, we had a baby with us and apparently, unbeknownst to us there are special tables that can accommodate babies, GO FIGURE!  Being that that was one of the dumbest things we'd ever heard, we told them to seat us at a "tap" table which of course was perfectly fine with a high chair.  I still chuckle at how idiotic this was.  The whole process was so unorganized and it showed.  We had to ask for silverware, water, and water refills.  To top everything off, the food was so mediocre.  I was truly dumbstruck at this point.  The only good thing, and I do mean only, were the meatballs.  If the options at the free buffet are going to be on their regular buffet, I truly couldn't see myself paying $10.00 for it anyway.  Maybe their other offerings are great, but based on my experience I will never find out.

Parks and Rec's resident carnivore Ron Swanson would be a happy camper saddling up to Bistro La Bon's brunch buffet. Waiters will literally bring you all the bacon and eggs they have. As well as thick French toast and chocolately waffles whose sweetness could supplement dessert, but only a fool would pass up a coconut macaroon. The lavish spread includes brisket, Swedish meatballs, a variety of salads, fresh fruit and pastries. With so much to choose from, you'll certainly get your money's worth ($16) and if you leave hungry, you must have done something wrong.

They have a great brunch on Sundays. They offer a buffet and you can order small plates ( which are included in the price). The food is very tasty. It's hard to make buffet food taste flavorful and interesting, but they have found a way.   From the outside, the place isn't much to look at. It's in an old shopping strip. However, the inside is cute and trendy.

My wife, friends and I have made it a tradition to visit Bistro every New Years, for at least the past 6 years. It has always been a hit with us, amazing food, great service. In 2018 though, it is obvious something has drastically changed in the food quality and the way they address the menu. This was the first year they offered a limited menu, in the past you could order off of the regular menu which is one of the reasons we always go there. We did not ask, so shame on us for booking the reservation without asking, we had assumed it would be the same. The limited menu featured 4 options, each with a 4 course serving for 70.00 a person.  I choose the halibut and my wife and friends choose the filet, which was nothing like the filet they had in the past. It seemed to be more of a bone in rib eye steak. The cut was different, it was a huge piece of meat which was not nearly as tender as usual. My halibut was pan seared to death, hard and dried up. The entrees and apps were of very large portions, too large in my opinion. It seems obvious they are focusing on quantity and not quality.  Our server was nice enough, fairly attentive. Not nearly as experienced as servers in the past though. She did not offer up one description of any menu item or make any suggestions. More of an order filler than a higher end server. I would expect this at many places, but this is one of the details that made Bistro what it was in the past. After all, this isn't Fridays.  The final nail in the coffin was the ever so famous bread pudding, which I had been looking forward to. Again, the recipe had changed, it was dried out and not nearly the same as in years past. I don't know if they have changed chefs, but this was disappointing to say the least. With drinks, tip and meals my wife and I spent over 200.00 for dinner, all for food and service that was average at best. I cannot say we have much interest in trying it again, which is sad because it is our tradition.

Food was good, but service wasn't great. I ate here for Queen's Feast, and it was almost like they forgot that my friend and I were at a table in the corner. It took almost 3 hours for them to complete the courses, and one of the waiters was extremely rude to the patrons at the table sitting next to us. I would advise you to make sure you have several hours to spend at dinner before eating here. I wish that I had a better experience because the food is really good. I would recommend the brie brule for sure.
This place is a gem. Bar bites and wine list are great. Have Jim, the bartender  make u something  special. He rocks....Dedicated patron. Chef Majid  kicks ass.

RIP OFF!!! Before Mother's Day we called to make reservations. We were told they were taking NO reservations for Brunch ... First come first served... We got there very early... 3rd ones in line! When they opened we expected to be seated... They asked if we had reservations... We reminded them they were not taking reservations... We were told it would be an hour wait minimum! They said they did take reservations for parties over 10!  Apparently they were holding all the tables in the empty restaurant for all those parties over 10... Their attitude was... Too bad... So sad... Wait however long or leave... Which we did!!! Never again!!! Service is always bad, food is cold, but I like the French Toast... Not worth it! Actually if I could give negative star I would!

Epic Fail---a friend and I came here for the free buffet lunch they were advertising this week, and highly disappointed. We had to wait well over our quoted time ( no biggie, a lot of people were there for FREE) they let several parties go ahead if us that came in after us. Granted they were pretty packed, but there was about enough room for 20 seats on the patio and it was a beautiful day, so no reason not to use it. We asked the hostess if we could just go in for a drink while we wait, she said no. It was like Fort Knox trying to even go in. After over 1hr  (quoted 40 min) wait we finally got sat at the bar. The staff was rude, including the manager...he was fussing at the bartender in front if us, totally unprofessional. We asked if there was drink specials, and the response was "uh-no don't you think free lunch is special enough" Dirty glasses were set in the bar beside us and ignored for most if the time we sat there. The food was bad, lacked flavor and selection. A little salt and pepper makes a world of difference...that should be culinary 101. Most if the time we went up to the buffet it was empty.  They need to leave the shrimp and grits up to Charleston restaurants, it tasted like instant grits w/shrimp thrown in as an after though....I make better shrimp and grits. No way would I'd pay $10 for this. Either they weren't prepared for the crowd or they have no idea what good food taste like. Also, they were doing free lunch yesterday and several people behind us in line said they had come yesterday for the same... They got in faster than we did...didn't think that was right, they'd already taken advantage if the freebie. Would NOT recommend this place, there are too many other great restaurants close by to chose from...spend your money there. Thank goodness it was free and I didn't have to pay for such a disappointing experience. #lame

If you go with friends, family or a date, this place will always delight! If you have never been to Bistro La Bon before, make sure you visit on a Sunday during their brunch buffet! Some of the items are table side so you place an order and they will bring it out to you (ex: eggs, bacon & waffles). Yes, this place does get busy during lunch but I have yet to find a better brunch spot! If your family visits you for the weekend, be sure to treat them to this place before they leave.... it will leave am amazing taste of Charlotte in their mouth while they travel back home!
OMG! What an experience! Went for restaurant week and was blown away!! Have been thinking about the steak I had last night all day! It was pure perfection. Can't wait to go back!
Food and service were good but to charge $15 for a straight up martini is ridiculous!  Are we in New York?  Won't be going back anytime soon.

For a place with a French name I was expecting it to be fancy. Of course it's in a strip mall, so I should've kept it real. We made reservations for 6 for a noon time brunch on Saturday. We were seated quickly, that's where the quickness ended. Our waiter didn't show up for a bit. When he came back the second time he took our drink order, wait again, then he took our food order, wait again. Food was meh. In fact, as I write this I can't recall anything except a rubbery English muffin from my eggs Benedict.  Insert wait again, hold it, hold it, finally he came back and we were able to ask for the bill. We thought he had quit because we didn't see him for about 20 minutes. Wait again to pay... Yikes. Moral of this story, this is somewhere you won't hate, but you definitely won't love. I would go back if I was invited by friends I don't know well enough to complain to.

Holy smokes this place is great. We tried a few of the small plates but have to say the gnocchi was the best. When our server asked if we wanted bread to sop it up, there was no hesitation. Had to order seconds as well.

This place is awesome and there isn't a bad thing to say about it. Our server was excellent, she brought us wine samples and was there for our every need. We don't usually order dessert but dinner was so good we had to try it, we were not disappointed. One of the owners even stopped by to see how our dinner was. There was not one drop of food left on any of our plates.

My first visit to this restaurant was yesterday for brunch. They had a specific Saturday brunch menu so I couldn't get what I went for (chocolate waffle). I ordered the Breakfast Burger and it was delicious! I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant and we had a wonderful waiter, Jake. Unfortunately, it took 45 minutes to get our food. While Jake was an awesome waiter he forgot about different things that we asked for because he was so busy with tables. It took another 15 minutes to get our check and 15 for him to pick up our check for us to pay. We went on our lunch break and this caused us to be late. If I had known that it would take that long to get food I would've went another day. The food was great...4 stars for the delays.

I returned for the Sunday buffet. Much better food. I particularly enjoyed the smoked salmon. Chocolate waffles were just meh, and I'm a huge chocoholic. I might try them for dinner with the hubby sometime

All I can say is, "Wow." Three of us had an early dinner and shared the following: Kale Salad Beet & Apple Tartare Salad Crispy Avocado & Asparagus Lavender Chicken Fried Brussels Swedish Meatballs  And, of course, dessert~ Brioche Bourbon Bread Pudding with caramel sauce. Everything was delicious, beautifully presented, service from Hunter was excellent!  I was visiting from San Diego, but, will definitely return when in Charlotte. Don't miss this restaurant!

Bistro la bon is an amazing up and coming restaurant. I think it is well established but getting the mainstream to step into this restaurant by a wig shop may be a feat. Besides the non choice location the intirior and food are some if the best in charlotte hands down.  My consort and i went to bistro la bon on a slow night. We order a variety of starters because we felt the most creative food was on that menu. We grilled halumi which was like a mozzerella grilled cheese on brioch and served with pears in port redux. Tomato-fennel soup: nuff said! The special mozerella was a miss for us not because of the mozz(amazzing) but because the pesto tasted like it was maxes out with spinich and no garlic or acid. We also got the duck confit which was served with crepe. It was drizzled with a sautern sauce which made me thick the whole dish was a delicious upscale version of chicken and waffles. For that dish to envoke that kind of memory was talent in execution. Dessert was an uneventful jd bread pudding. Iv had better.  Service was fab however i heard another server saying he didn't particularly like a certain wine and while i know u may have a certain taste, you sounded off- putting. You should have apealed to ur customers better. Talk about the flavors in a wine not that u don't like it.  I will be back bistro la bon!

Extremely accomodating for someone who eats a cruelty-free diet! The food was awesome as well as the service. I would definitely recommend if you eat fish and meat too (my hubby said his meal was great!)
Overpriced.   Overrated.  3 Stars instead of 2 because they actually do show some imagination in their menu.  Unfortunately they lack the skill to pull it off.

Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. We chose four different appetizers to share and topped it off with the most incredible bread pudding either one of us had ever eaten. At that point, we had to call out the chef and shower him with praise!
Great food and service. Thank you Darren ( server) for the humour and for making my wife's birthday a pleasant one.
Best brunch in Plaza!!  We love bringing our family and friends to this little gem.  It delivers amazing food every time.

For 9 days that we were in Charlotte, we ate at this place almost every night and everything on the menu. You forget the neighborhood as soon as you walk into this place. Very cozy and nice. If I ever go back to Charlotte, I will certainly eat there as often as I can.

I have been to Bistro three times; once for dinner, second brunch and last a surprise birthday party for my girlfriend--the last being the best experience yet.  I contacted Bistro and inquired about hosting a party between 20 and 25 on a Friday night.  They were able to accommodate and so I started planning.  The chef called me to discuss the cake, twice (the second with a variation of his first idea).  I, and others, have dietary restrictions preventing us from partaking; however, it was beautiful and others noted it tasted fantastic.  I give Bistro four stars.  The food is good, the atmosphere wonderful, and they did an outstanding job helping me with my girlfriend's birthday party.  While the menu is not extensive, my only critique is fewer vegetable choices than I might like (never the less, they were able to accommodate my heavy dietary restrictions).  I've always received great service, be it the host, serving staff or chef.  I definitely will recommend this to others, and for any number of occasions.

So delish. I love dinner, lunch or brunch here. With or without the kids. Always accommodating, from a group of 30 to friend with strollers.   Have a mimosa or cocktail. Enjoy the atmosphere and cool vibe. Brunch is not cheap, but it is a buffet so you can eat up.

We went for Mother's Day brunch and the food was just average. The tenderloin was extremely undercooked and the eggs were undercooked. it was overcrowded so everyone was bumping into each other. The service was slow and and for $35 apiece Not worth it at all. The Mimosa's were good but you need a couple before you see the check
Bistro was great. The service was amazing! The crafted cocktails were very well done and the ambiance was perfect. Definitely would recommend a must if you are needing a great date night out

I've been to Bistro La Bon three times now, and each time I get the same thing because it's just so good. They have a kale salad that I get with grilled chicken, and it is perfectly prepared every time I go. The atmosphere is good for dates, the service is attentive, and the price is reasonable given the high quality of the food. It's clear that the kitchen takes pride in their work.   The only reason it's not five stars has nothing to do with the restaurant itself, but the rash of violent crime in the area recently. A couple was robbed and shot in the parking lot, another young woman was shot and killed nearby and several others have been robbed. Last time we were there the police had a tower in the parking lot, which I'm sure helps, but it's a shame such a good place is being hurt by their location.

I was in Charlotte for business and we ended up here for a late dinner. The food was good and I enjoyed the atmosphere. The only thing that knocks it down a star is that we were seated in a table where one side was a bench along the wall and the other was chairs. It was comfortable however the tables were extremely close together - making it uncomfortable to get out and you were also part of your neighbors' conversations. Interesting.

I'm updating and upgrading my rating to a 4 star approval. This is largely on the strong back of their bunch item Pyttipanna. Damn that was so good. We came back and had a generally much better experience. Service still seemed a little goofy, but much of that could have been our server feeding off our own vibe. We were all pretty severely hungover, a little out of it ourselves and craving hair of the dog so no points deducted there as our service pretty much matched our disposition. The food was definitely the star, and I am very pleased to have returned. Get the Pyttipanna if you 1) are here for brunch, and 2) eat meat. It was everything I could have hoped for. Thank you.

My first visit will be my last. It was supposed to be a special dinner for two. The first thing that caught my attention was that the wait staff was a little bit under-groomed. The menu was not exciting as I had expected and had heard about. The server told us the specials. The server stated they had a 'Surf and Turf special which is a filet mignon with a lobster tail served on a bed of garlic mashed potatoes'. It was the only thing either of us thought stood out  I asked the price expecting between $30 - 40. The server had to check and returned telling us it was $46! It was way overpriced comparatively, esp. considering the location and this was not formal dining.   It was a special evening, so I figured I won't worry about the price. We both ordered the Surf and Turf. As the server approached with our food, my blood immediately began to boil. On top of the filets, looked like one large shrimp popping out of both of our meals. It was shocking to see a tiny piece of lobster sticking out of an EMPTY lobster tail shell. Not only was the lobster tail shell small, but most of the meat had been removed. it wasn't possible to be that much smaller than the shell it was in.   I opted to eat my lobster in two small bites instead of one medium bite. Basically It was like cutting a shrimp in half. The lobster 'popper' was too small to comment on. The filet mignon was cooked very well, but it was bland. The garlic mashed potatoes were bland. There were two asparagus sprigs for garnish.   I just resolved myself to never going there again and did not complain to the staff since it was a special dinner and I figured any restaurant that would gouge and cheat their customers that way is not worth my time or my future business. I just cut my losses for the sake of the evening. It would have been a very awkward conversation regardless of it being a special night out.

If you're looking for a somewhat simple brunch menu with a little flare then this is it! The Saturday brunch menu is it! The menu is not extremely extensive but at 1:00 on a Saturday the food was delivered quickly and the presentation was fair. The  portion sizes will make you satisfied but probably not full/stuffed. The side eggs my friend ordered were quite greasy and you can see the coat of oil to the side or the plate. The potato cakes are somewhat bland. (And I'm not one to add salt/pepper unless absolutely necessary) The crab and chives omelette had good helpings of crab pieces however it tasted like imitation crab. Overall, the food was adequate and i would go again to try different food options. I will say the signature drinks and mimosas ($3) were great! My friend's French toast was amazing (super fluffy, right amount of powdered sugar and sweetness) I'll definitely go back for that. The service was good and the ambiance is nice with the indoor and outdoor seating.

I know people love Bistro La Bon for brunch, but I hated it. The all- you-can-eat bar is the only option and seemed to feature a hodge-podge of mediocre breakfast and lunch items.   BUT, I love them for dinner. I love the mix of French and Southern cuisines with great flavors and plate presentation. Also, they are members of  the10% NC Campaign, helping build North Carolina's local food economy. Kudos!

One of my favorite places to eat at night! This appeared to be a very busy Charlotte Restaurant Week for them, but they were able to seat us at the specific table we requested a few minutes ahead of our reservation time.   My husband and I both had tomato bisque for Course 1, which was delicious. For Course 2 I had the fried brussel sprouts & my husband tried the brie brulee ... both were excellent.   For Course 3 I had my usual Creekside Farms filet with demiglaze served with mashed potatoes, roasted onion, and a roasted pear slice. The filet was the perfectly cooked medium that I requested, and super tender. The portions on the filet and pear were a bit smaller than when eating off the regular menu, which was fine as the first two courses were very generously portioned. My husband's Course 3 was his favorite Swedish Meatballs from the regular menu, and I think he would have licked the plate if there hadn't been a friend sitting at the next table.   Course 3 was the flourless chocolate truffle cake with a small scoop of in-house ice cream. That night the standard ice cream pairing with this selection was a coconut sorbet, but I subbed out for basil ice cream at no additional charge ... a slightly stronger batch than usual, but it worked really well with the richness of the cake. Hubby had his favorite bourbon brioche bread pudding with caramel sauce and homemade vanilla ice cream, topped with something that looked like raisins but tasted more like roasted blueberries. I got to enjoy the last two bites of that ... yum!!  Our server was very friendly and clearly knowledgeable about the menu. Food service was a bit slower than usual due to the crowd, but that was fine because we got more food than usual and it was nice to have a few minutes for each course to settle a bit. Usually the manager comes by to check on us, but that didn't happen this visit ... again OK and understandable, as the bar area was quite busy when we left.  First timers need to be aware that lunch/brunch is a different menu, which is OK but not nearly as good as the evening menu.

Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed. My sorority and I were there for brunch and I ordered something light, specifically the Asieigo Grits and Fruit. The fruit was fine, but the grits were not to my liking.

Unbelievable brunch!  Best I've had in Charlotte.   The blend of buffet and a large carte makes it so user friendly for the entire family.  Also awesome dinners.   The way they do that duck gets me all ducked up!!!  That's a good thing!!
Sunday brunch was delicious! Their eggs, bacon, and asiago grits were very flavorful. I highly recommend the Brioche French Toast. For the chocolate lovers, their chocolate waffles are spectacular!

I travel with my job, and am always looking for a special restaurant where my team and I can unwind with a glass of wine and some great food after a day of flight travel.   Three of us were quite impressed with Bistro la Bon! The arugula pear salad was perfect, the scallops and tenderloin small plates exceptional. Top it off with attentive and perfectly non intrusive wait staff, and a lovely owner Elise who made our first time feel like we were longtime familiar patrons. Definitely recommend for atmosphere, service and excellent food. Cant wait to come back! also, this would be the perfect date night restaurant.

Ashely and Miguel are always so friendly and come by our table to say hello and chit chat for a bit. The service has always been great and the food is delicious. I have been for dinner and brunch on the weekends. The Sunday brunch is well worth the $22. It's a buffet, not anything like Golden Corral lol, and they make fresh eggs, bacon, chocolate waffles, French toast and eggs Benedict fresh!
Atmosphere, very nice. Great Sunday brunch! Swedish meatballs and chocolate waffles were my favorite.

I went there tonight with a group of friends.  Because one of our friend is moving away.  She always liked their food.  And we hope it would be a good memory for everyone.  However, our experience is far from good.  The waitress had a huge attitude.  She got the orders completely messed up.  We were there at 6:30.  The food did not come till 10:30.  The portion is so small that it took less than 5 mins to finish.    The waitress did not come to check with us one single time during the meal.  I order the duck breast.  For how long it took, you would think they are catching the free range duck and killing it in the back!  It taste good, but Charlotte has plenty of restaurants that have the similar quality of food, same price range, but bigger portion and much much much better service.    The waitress brought out the bill and argue with us that it's not her fault that the kitchen didn't see our order.  Seriously?  As customers, we don't care who in the restaurant messed up.  We ate three plates of bread within the four hours.  And by the way, I don't think the bread is complimentary.  You have to ask for it!  No butter comes with the bread either.  When we were complaining to the manager that its been almost 4 hours, the waitress walked by and said " its only been two!"  Right, because two hours is acceptable?  The manager is nice enough to come apologize after we complained to her, and she gave the discount to the final bill.  But seriously, life is too short to wait for 4 hours in a restaurant for your dinner.  I have been in Charlotte for 4+ years, we eat out few times a week.  This is by far the worst experience ever.  Save yourselves.  This place is not worth a visit!
Love the Sunday brunch there. It was only 15 bucks and offers a pretty wide range of food. Chocolate waffle and french toast came with the brunch too. Both YUMMY and must-try food.

Bistro la Bon offers an amazing weekend brunch buffet that will leave you wanting nothing more. Your server or bartender will bring you scrambled eggs and waffles or French toast with bacon, but the buffet offers everything else you could possibly want at brunch.  For $20pp you get a salad bar, many cold fruit options (including a yummy fruit salad), hot items such as cheddar bisquits and gravy, slow roasted beef, Mac and cheese with peppers and tons of flavor, and so much more. There is a pastry buffet as well with small bites and Danish.  Mimosas are $3 and on Sundays you can add one after 12pm (NC LAW).  Overall Bistro is absolutely worth a visit and I can't wait to return for lunch sometime soon.

Like many of the patrons on here, I too, decided to visit this restaurant based on the high reviews.  A couple friends and I decided to stop in for Saturday brunch. They were not extremely busy but we had a longer than average wait time to be seated.  No one besides us were waiting to be seated.  The waitress, which was also the hostess, informed us that they were cleaning a table off for us.  After about 10 minutes we were seated at a table with hair on it.  I will say our server was very pleasant. After placing our order we had to wait another 15 minutes for the food to arrive.  I ordered the French toast which was delicious, however it was only one slice.  Needless to say I was still hungry. In addition 2 out of the 3 checks were miscalculated.  I was thoroughly disappointed and dont think I will be visiting there again.

We arrived for a dinner reservation and were seated promptly. The decor is such a beautiful surprise as compared to the generally uninspiring exterior strip-mall architecture. Cool tables and chairs, great seating at the bar, even great lighting, and very very friendly staff.   Food - we ordered 5 small plates and it was a lot for 2 people, maybe a little too much, but worth it!  Lobster mac and cheese is absolutely essential. We loved everything... gnocchi, brussel sprouts, shrimp and chorizo, meatballs, all were cooked perfectly, and food came out relatively quickly. As we watched other tables receive their food, we had a little order envy because every dish really did look amazing.   I am only disappointed that we waited so long to visit this fun, unique, unpretentious restaurant. It is an excellent dining experience, and a terrific addition to the Elizabeth / Midwood rotation.
After trying it twice, I would have to rate the food good, but not great! Atmosphere is nice with great city views. Nice lounge/bar space.

I went to Bistro la Bon last night with a group of 5 for a birthday dinner.  It was cold and rainy out so there were not many people in the restaurant at all.  The decor was beautiful but there was no music playing, the only thing I could hear was the air conditioner.  Our server never told us his name and he was rather odd and soft spoken making it difficult to understand him when he told us about the specials.  I started with the goat cheese peppadew dish and it was delicious.  Others in my group ordered the lavender chicken and pork belly dishes which everyone raved about.  I had one of the specials, the rack of lamb with finger potatoes, squash and kale.  Every dish we had was very good including the desserts.  We all shared the flourless chocolate cake, carrot cake and creme brulle.  The food was great here but the experience still left something to be desired, eating somewhere that was silent as the grave was awkward.

Mother's Day brunch was not particularly good. The only items I enjoyed from the buffet were the meatballs and mac & cheese. Items not on the buffet and ordered from the kitchen, like the eggs, were limited, bland and uninteresting. Not sure if I would go back. Service was friendly and good.

Bistro La Bon is absolutely fantastic!  Especially if you are looking for a restaurant with the perfect ambiance, friendly staff, and food that will leave you wanting more after each bite.  My husband and I went to Bistro La Bon for our third wedding anniversary this past Wednesday and left with a mutual feeling...it is the best culinary and dining experience we have had in Charlotte!  We wanted to enjoy a relaxed yet romantic dinner so we chose to make reservations for the ten bite tasting, which only costs $35 per person. Each meal was uniquely different from one another, and we were always so curious as to what Chef Majid was going to surprise us with next.  To make the night even more special, my husband and I were the only ones participating in the tasting, this just so happened by chance.  The bartender actually wrote down our likes and dislikes to have the chef tailor the tastings to our liking.  While it was fabulous to have this attention, it saddened us that more people were not there to experience such amazing and unique food.  Definitely do not miss out on this restaurant!  What made the food so delicious is that it tasted as though each and every meal was made from scratch and that all the ingredients were fresh and complimented each other.  I don't want to give away all the chef's secrets but these were just a few of our favorite samplings: the goat cheese stuffed peppadew peppers with honey ginger glaze and carmelized onion and the brioche bread pudding is out of this world.  I think my husband and I will be making this our go-to restaurant in the Charlotte area.  And don't forget to try out the brunch - just as impressive as the tasting!
Very good well seasoned and prepared food. This is a diamond in the rough don't let the outside fool you. Awesome lunch prices and I can't say enough about how good the food is.

If I could eat only one restaurant every weekend for the rest of my life, this might be the one I would choose.  Two of us went on a Sunday for brunch. I called ahead to put us on the list. We were promptly seated around noon.  It was busy but not packed, yet.  Upon seating the waiter asks for your drink order and if you would like the french toast and chocolate waffles. Might I add that he french toast is some or the best you will ever have. The waffles were only OK to me and I love chocolate.  We took our plates and headed for the brunch buffet. The fresh fruit was wonderful, all of the baked goods were top notch. The macaroons are better than Amelies'. The sweet potato hash missed a beat (underdone potatoes) but that was the only misstep. I hardly wanted to touch my eggs due to the amazing smorgasbord available but bacon was quite good. They had an array of cold and warm salads including roasted beet as well as a black forest ham orzo option. The Swedish meatballs are a must if you are a meat eater.   Suffice it to say, you have to visit Bistro La Bon at least once for Brunch if you can. It is absolutely worth every penny. Bring your appetite and you will not be disappointed.

A breakfast from heaven - as good as it gets.  Omelette cooked to perfection, not overdone like 99.5% are.  And the combination of salmon and chives was extraordinary but not overdone.  And the hash browns!  Nobody does hash browns like this!  We will visit again and again.  Can't wait to try a dinner.  Even the service on a very busy day was very strong.  A little pricey but well worth it.

Lemme tell ya. When you roll up to BLB do NOT be turned off by the weave store and the shady Dollar Tree or whatever is in that creepy plaza. Just understand real estate isn't cheap, and this is a gem among cz's.   The first time I went to BLB it was all about the lunch menu, which was either 10 or 12 bucks and included a drink, salad, bread and a meal. I had the Swedish meatballs and lingonberry...my goodness, this is NOT IKEA meatballs. Tender, juicy, super flavorful and smothered in gravy. Salad delicious and fresh. The value was insane and I vowed to go back again.   The second time, was for brunch, which was spectacular. SMORGASBOARD of culinary delights. The meatballs were there, along with brisket that melted in your mouth. Fresh pastries, baked breads, to-order French toast or chocolate waffles, salads, pastas, you name it!!   The quality was great, everything cooked to perfection.   Then...came my fifth time. (yeah, we went for brunch a whole bunch) Something was sorely amiss. The roasted veggies weren't fully roasted and were hard. The pork was tough. The service with taking away plates, slow.   I'm really hoping the 5th star can be earned with those improvements. Bistro La Bon does up classy food in a relaxed setting. Unpretentious and well executed. Just wish the consistency of the brunch comes back!!

Food was excellent,  scallops and octopus were one of the best I have ever had. Grilled perfectly and tender. Don't let the surroundings fool you. Once inside, let the food and service speak for itself. Desert was awesome as well as the server. A great first date place,,,,don't be scared to go,,,,

Unique restaurant by Uptown Charlotte. The owner is one of the most hard working and generous person I have ever met. Bistro is one of my absolute favorite places to come eat in Charlotte! The brunch has to be my favorite- very different and delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant if you are going out with some friends, especially at night. They have a bar, a small lounge area, and the rest for dining (also outside sitting). Very chill and friendly location. If you are looking for something other than the usual American bar/restaurant, visit this place!

This review has nothing to do with Bistro's brunch service, which I've heard is good.  Let's be honest. Tapas is always, ALWAYS a rip-off. But you can limit how much you're screwing your customer to where they don't leave profoundly unsatisfied. See: Good Food on Montford, Duckworth's Cellar.  The food at Bistro is Good. That's it. There's nothing crazy unique. It's all very standard fare with a french twist at best. Everything came out hot. Our server was actually really excellent (I wish I remembered her name!). She's the sole reason for 2 stars over one.  But the pricing here is spit-in-your-face insulting. $18 for half of a Octopus tentacle and one and a half creamer potatoes? That is not an exaggeration. Cocktails are $13-$16, but unlike Bistro's competitors they're sold in half-height tumblers. Why bother having the bartender make the damn things if you get 4 sips of liquid after all the ice?  We were castoffs from the aggressively unfriendly seating and chaos of Soul across the street. Bistro must survive on the dozens of people who aren't seated there an hour after their reservation. I know I won't make the mistake of migrating here again.

Loved it. Wanting to have a nice but quick dining experience with some friends prior to the Led Zeppelin Symphony last week they suggested Bisto La Bon...and am I glad they did. From the Brie Brûlée to the Grilled Spanish Octopus each bite was a delectable feast. Our waitress Jess was attentive and made great suggestions. Would I return?...you bet.  You can enjoy small plates or order a full entree, they'll even split the entree as a small plate.  The wine list is great, the atmosphere upscale but far from stuffy. Would I suggest it to a friend, only if I value their friendship :-)

Bistro is my favorite brunch place in town. Im not a fan of buffets but this smorgasbord has changed my mind..at least at Bistro. Everything is fresh and tasty. I prefer the French toast over the chocolate waffle; however, they are both good. The French toast is the best ever!! My other favorites include the delicious lemon dill vinaigrette dressing over the salad, the beef brisket (melt in your mouth tenderness), the pumpkin cheesecake muffins and the highly addictive fresh homemade coconut macaroons. They are truly perfection w/ the right amount of chewy sweet goodness. I would highly suggest reservations for Sunday brunch. Think I will go this Sunday..:)

My wife and I came here for brunch to celebrate Mother's Day.  We arrived at 1:30, they said there was a 1 hour wait, but we got a table within 20 minutes.  It would have been worth the hour, it was that good.  The buffet had amazing meatballs, mac and cheese, Scottish salmon, fresh fruit, plus they brought out chocolate waffles, eggs Benedict and French toast from the kitchen.  The macaroons were fresh baked and amazing.  The buffet was $30 and the mimosas were $3.  Trendy "industrial" atmosphere.  Highly recommended.

We were in a hurry. Luckily we visited on Sunday. $15 for your brunch and they have... CHOCOLATE WAFFEL. Yes.. it's as delicious as you think it is. If only I wasn't full from the rest of buffet (i.e. beef roast, home made mozzarella, swedish meetballs, pasta salad, home made scone... yea there're more), I would order another one. Anyway... next time I'll come starving and make sure it's a four hour brunch!
I have had a few things from the menu and would recommend the eggs benedict.  Best I've had in Charlotte.  I've found their house cured salmon to be a little too salty for my taste.

i had the pleasure of going to bistro la bon with someone who is buddies with the chef, and got to do a tasting menu. we got to try about 80% of the menu, served as small(er) plates.  it would be too tedious to go through every course, but i give bistro la bon 4 stars with no reservations. great wine menu, too.

Went there today for lunch, we had: Fried Brussels, Pan seared potato gnocchi, Swedish meatballs, grilled Spanish octopus, spicy shrimp chorizo and seafood Mac and cheese. Everything was really delicious. Our server did a great job with the timing of the various plates. It is a little pricey but no different than other tapas places. It is located on the end of a strip mall but don't let that dissuade you, it is very nice inside, kind of a French/European ambiance going on. I will definitely go back.

Tucked in a sketchy strip mall (anchored by a Family Dollar, so that should tell you something) is a gem of a restaurant called Bistro La Bon. Blink and you'll miss it, no joke. But foodies in the CLT know a terrific restaurant, and an even better Sunday brunch, no matter where the eatery may be.  I like the cozy, intimate decor. Plenty of Persian-style rugs line the hardwoods, and the lighting and atmosphere lends itself to conversation and laughs. It's a terrific place to bring a date or a group of friends and family for a great meal.  The Sunday brunch is Bistro La Bon's raison d'etre. Keep in mind the buffet is rather small, so if you're expecting a Golden Corral-sized DIY helpings, you'll be slightly disappointed.  I love that your buffet serving also comes with complimentary scrambled eggs, chocolate waffles, thick-cut bacon AND buttery french toast. For real. And, yes, they are complimentary. They say such nice things about me...(*groan*)  One thing to watch out for: if you love your Bloody Marys drowned in Tabasco, then you'll love 'em here. Me, I like 'em not so spicy. I struggled mightily trying to finish mine, but I simply threw in the towel. No shame in admitting I don't have enough hair on my chest to finish this spicy bastard. So I opted instead for a Mimosa. Yeah, whatever. Don't you judge me.  So for what it's worth, BLB is fast becoming one of my go-to spots for Sunday brunch. In fact, I may need to drag the missus and the wee wonder this Sunday...
Moan worthy yumminess, all four courses. The evening was perfect with a wonderful server, Wes. We decided to try Bistro for  Queen's Feast. So glad we did. We'll be back soon!

Have eaten at this place a few times now (dinner and Sunday Brunch).  Really friendly service.  Each time for dinner, our waiters have been very knowledgable about the menu, wines, etc (which is a plus as I'm not an expert on French Cuisine).  Have not had a bad meal yet.  Further the brunch on the weekends is a great way to start the hangover recovery process.

I have a hard time rating this restaurant.  The service was horrendous ....if Ashleigh is your server....change tables ....she is rude....condescending.....opinionated ....unlikable....the food however....once you get it is really really good.  I think the chef genuinely has a passion for excellence however the overall experience suffers due to poor poor rude service (Ashleigh)......change your profession .....we had 8:00 reservations and at 9:20 were told by Ashleigh that we could not order yet because of a kitchen back-up..... A member of our group approached the chef to ask about the delay and within minutes we were served a number of delicious dishes......why have waitresses when you can order directly from the chef .....he was fantastic btw.....after our $500 bill which included a huge tip for Ashleigh we told each other that Bistro La Bon is definitively off our list .....sorry chef......front of the house service unfortunately leaves the biggest impression .......au revoir  Bistro La Bon!!!!!!
Great place for brunch! Its quite a wait but would say definitely worth it. Pri fixe! The buffet part was great and its awesome that they also offer single serve made to orders in the same price.

I went with a friend to Bistro La Bon for the first time in Saturday night and LOVED it! We intended to go to Sole but the two-hour wait led us for a short walk to BLB. We got right in and sat in the bar and ordered a few small plates to split with a glass of wine. The lamb belly was absolutely amazing. It was the most tender and juicy lamb I've ever had. Also, the brie brulee was out of this world. The service was great and I absolutely recommend this restaurant and I will definitely be going back.

Food is great. Service was mediocre. I usually still tip 20% at a buffet but this girl was phoning it in so hard that I was forced to leave 10%. I've been in for dinner and the service was better -- they're slow to get to your table but happy to help once they're there. The service at the bar is always good. I guess that's why there are always people eating at the bar.   My recommendation is request a good server when making the reservation. Again, the food is great! Their bread pudding knocked my socks off and the Sunday brunch is definitely worth the $20.

We've been to Bistro la Bon for brunch but never for dessert and wow... it was awesome. The photos don't do it justice but I can easily say Bistro la Bon has some of the best dessert in Charlotte and is worth checking out if you haven't already.  We tried the Vanilla Orange Creme Brulee, Flourless Chocolate Truffle Cake, and the Bourbon Brioche Bread Pudding with caramel sauce & vanilla ice cream with mango sorbet. The easy favorite of the night was the chocolate truffle cake and the mango sorbet. The creme brulee was delicious but we missed the vanilla orange flavor completely. Next time you're in the area head over to Bistro la Bon and get something sweet :)

Came here for Saturday a la carte brunch with positive vibes. The decor was nice with a great ambience but the service was lacking. Very slow! Took forever to order and the place wasn't very busy. To add to the poor service, the food was just lackluster- potatoes were crunchy and overcooked, eggs Benedict was overdone but yet not very warm and lastly the grits were in definite need of some salt and flavor. We all left pretty disappointed.

Went here for 1st time, passed by several times but from the outside parking lot it didn't look inviting. Don't let that deter you, this place is very nice once you get inside. The décor is casual, plenty of light. Our server, Lauren, was so helpful and very attentive. She gave us great suggestions from the menu. I had their signature omelet and my husband had the waffles. Both were delicious and fresh. We very rarely order dessert, but thought "why not" Lauren suggested the bourbon bread pudding. Excellent choice, not too sweet. Great way to end the meal. Will definitely be back, going to try the Sunday smorgasbord next time.

I often eat alone, and enjoy good food. Bistro La Bon is not a place for someone like me. The hostess tried to seat me at the bar, even though the majority of tables were empty. After I insisted on a table, I was placed in a center-room two seater even though window seats were available. When I requested a small table at a wall or window, it was suggested I take a seat at the bar. Needless to say, I won't be coming back again.

Third time I've been here. The food, wine, atmosphere, and service are good. I particularly like their brunch and their french toast. I wish value was a higher priority. Last night's dinner cost more than I thought it should have for what we got. A happier medium needs to be achieved with, especially, the tapas dishes. Example: The "Seared Sea Scallops" dish came with, count 'em, one (1) scallop. I think they need to remove the S from the menu title!

The worst service ever! My drink didn't come until after I asked the waiter 3 times and he finally brought it after our food arrived! It wasn't even that busy. Food was amazing, but service makes or breaks a place. And this service was awful. When I needed something else, I just asked the maitre di.

So after reading many stellar reviews about the Bistro La Bon brunch, my husband and I decided to check it out this past Sunday. Unfortunately, we didn't seem to get the hype on this occasion.   Bistro La Bon is located in a shopping center in Plaza Midwood. It's the corner spot and easily visible from the street. Ample parking since the place is in a strip small. Fairly small inside but I loved that they had couches in order to make the wake a bit comfier. The décor inside was very cute!! I also liked the outdoor seating that they had.   We arrived around noon on Sunday and were quoted a 45 minute wait. Grabbed a mimosa and took a seat on one of the comfy couches! $3 Mimosas for the win! After about an hour and fifteen, we were finally seated. Totally don't mind waiting at restaurants....though, patience is definitely one of my personal weaknesses. However, I totally appreciate when places over estimate the wait, so then I get excited when it is under time. Going 30 minutes over the quoted time when I was hunger games level of hungry was not the best start.   Anyways, our waiter came and explained that the buffet contains many items and that we could also order more. We ordered the eggs, bacon, french toast, and the chocolate waffle and then hit the buffet. The buffet contained a large assortment of items from fruit to pastries to potatoes to brisket. I would probably have to say that my favorite item was the biscuits and gravy or the briskett. My least favorite was the jalapeno mac n cheese (I love love mac n cheese and the strong jalapeno flavor was just not my cup of tea!). As for the food that came to the table, the french toast was the winner. As in, we definitely ordered a second order of the french toast! The bacon was overly greasy and not that great. The chocolate waffles were pretty good though to make up for the bacon.   While everything we ate was tasty, I just don't think I can justify the $22 buffet charge (fairly steep in comparison to other Charlotte brunch spots) when nothing that we ate was absolutely amazing. Service was not great (I believe we saw our waiter like 3 times, if that), a long wait for a table, and good (not great) food, made me land at a solid 3 stars for this experience. With all this being said, I do want to check out Bistro La Bon for dinner!
Sunday all you can eat brunch was delicious.  It is a tad bit pricey if you eat like I do (all you can eat bacon!) but the overall quality is good.

Very nice cozy spot! Went for brunch and it was worth the $22. I would definitely return and recommend it . The food was delish, I'm not a fan on buffets but everything was fresh hot and yummy. Eggs and fresh toast made to order! Yummy to my tummy!

I came here for the Sunday brunch buffet and was pleasantly surprised by the spread. Everything from the waffles covered in chocolate and whip cream, to the meatballs and gravy, was delicious. I thought I would be able to control myself but alas, I left with a bloated, yet happy stomach. GG.  They've done a fantastic job decorating the restaurant, giving it a rustic, homey feel that certainly adds to the enjoyable experience. On top of that, our server was friendly and very well-spoken.  If I'm back in CLT, I will make an excuse to return to Bistro La Bon.

Great for a nice dinner, but the brunch is unbelievable!  I didn't want to leave.  Best french toast I've ever had, and that's just a smidge of what you can sink your teeth into at their massive brunch buffet.  Don't let the strip mall fool you.  The interior is large and welcoming.  Consider reservations for weekend brunch.

Went there during restaurant week, made the best choice of all the available restaurants.... The food was excellent. The dishes we tried worth mentioning are kale salad, mussels, crispy avocado and asparagus, lavender chicken (never knew chicken would taste this different and so delicious) Scottish Salmon and bread pudding (never had stuck a great bread pudding before). The ambience was good, make sure you ask for a seat near a window, has good views of uptown Charlotte. Will surely go back
Great place to dine, good food, and service is always top notch. Good selection on menu and varied prices.

What a hidden gem! $3 mimosas & bellinis, and $5 bloody Mary's! Saturday brunch did not disappoint!! I got eggs, potatoes, grits, and fruit (don't judge) and it was all so tasty and flavorful! All of that for only $11! Wowza.  My friend got the French toast ($9) .. it was a little disappointing as it was just one piece of bread and rather small. She ordered a side of bacon ($6) which helped.  Only negative comment.. pricing on sides was just silly compared to everything else on the menu.  Our server was so funny and nice - very attentive and accommodating. I'll definitely be back.

I had one of my favorite meals in Charlotte ever here!  Service: exceptional, our waiter was very friendly and waited on us very attentively Ambience: I went for lunch on a Saturday. There were not many people there but it was simple yet elegant inside. Don't let the proximity to a wig store and Dollar Tree deter you! Food: First, bread comes out. It is very good, you will not be sorry to at least sample it, especially the more inventive flavors (they rotate). The salad that comes with most meals is simple but light and dressed in house vinaigrette that is slightly citrusy but very good. I ordered the vegetable sandwich (with lots of veggies and goat cheese). It was served on cranberry walnut bread; although this may seem like a strange combination, it was delightful. The sweetness of the roasted veggies and the tang of the goat cheese played well with the sweet but hearty bread. I would definitely order this again. There are not a ton of vegetarian options but it is definitely doable to have a good vegetarian meal here. I split the Bourbon Brioche Bread Pudding with Caramel Sauce & Vanilla Ice Cream with my friend. It was very good. I think that bourbon, caramel, and bread pudding are meant to be. The texture and taste were spot on. It was a perfect dessert to share (we were already very full anyway).  Go here for a date or to meet a friend. I haven't tried the Sunday brunch but that is next on my list.

The brunch lives up to the hype. The french toast is the best Ive ever had, and the buffet items were delicious. The buffet had a good mix of breakfast, lunch and dessert items. Chic atmosphere, friendly and attentive servers, and did I mention the french toast? I had multiple servings. Well worth the very reasonable $22 each. Cant wait to go back.
Very cool setting. Everything on the Sunday brunch buffet was so flavorful without being over the top! And cheap mimosas too

Wow! This place is one of a kind. The Sunday brunch here is truly decadent. I've never seen a brunch operate in this way - a traditional buffet table set up but with additional freshly made dishes brought to you from the kitchen straight to your table.   From the buffet table I had the Mac and cheese, the grits, the Swedish meatballs, and the biscuits and gravy. Each of these foods was excellent, but I'd say the grits were my favorite with the Mac and cheese at a close second. I'm a sucker for a good cheese grit and these really delivered.   From the kitchen, there was French toast, regular eggs and bacon, eggs Benedict, and chocolate waffles offered. My favorite from those would definitely be the French toast - super sweet and moist. I wasn't so much a fan of the eggs Benedict though as it seemed a little bland and the eggs were a bit overdone and not runny at all. The eggs and bacon were just what you'd expect - nothing bad but nothing mind blowing. But the yummy things truly outweighed the meh things in this scenario.   Some additional items that I did not try were some cauliflower and salmon. My brunch-mates thought they were both good though!    The place was very busy for the Sunday though, so keep that in mind if you're looking to go to brunch. Also, make sure your entire party is there because they will not seat you partially. Also, the waiters were incredibly attentive and helpful with bringing food.   Final verdict - You should 100% check out this restaurant for a great brunch experience! It is a truly decadent experience and leaves you stuffed and satisfied.

I cannot express how terrible the service was during brunch.  Our waiter completely ignored us, served all the tables around us even stopped to chat basketball with the teen next to us and flirt with the table of 30 something women next to us while our drinks were empty and we had plates piled on the table.  He brought refills and the off the buffet orders to everyone else, we never received our second off the buffet order, after over 30 minutes of waiting we gave up and asked for our check.  The dish staff brought us refills after passing our table a few times.  The food is great but we won't be going back.
Good food all the time ! But, they can revise the menu a little.. sometimes its the same brunch buffet.. and for regulars it gets boring !

I've been here three times and I cannot complain. The cocktails are really good and the brunch is top notch in Charlotte. Finally had a chance to go for dinner and the presentation and staff service and timeliness was definitely spot on. Simply put this is a good place to hang out have a good meal with friends and not feel overwhelmed or like somebody's pushing you out the door. Definitely will be back

Went to the free wine tasting at Bistro La Bon last night. Excellent selection of wines on the tasting and on the wine list. A very comfortable atmosphere. Tasting was held on couches nestled near the front door. We ordered a charcuterie plate and it was excellent but it was overpriced for the amount of food on it. There was no cheese or bread served with it. A huge white platter held the miniscule amount of meat.  As we say in  advertising, good use of white space. They need to beef up the amount of food on their platters or get smaller platters. Service there was excellent. A few tweaks and they'd get a 5 star rating from me.

Passing by the sketchtastic strip mall this Bistro La Bon is in, I would have never guessed such a wonderful place could exist within it. Before even walking through the door, the aroma of bacon, eggs and other goodies hit me and I knew I had made the right decision to dine here. This is a smaller establishment so reservations would probably be good and you will see a variety of people there being Plaza Midwood and all. Not being too impressed by the brunch options in Charlotte I was hoping they wouldn't let me down and they didn't, not even in the slightest way.   They have a wonderful selection of brunch goodies such as the standard eggs, bacon and pastries but also some other random bites like swedish meatballs, pot roast, pasta salad (with a kick!),homemade mozzarella with tomato and basil and more. Unlike some other establishments, the selection isn't overwhelming which is a nice change of pace since I like to go to the buffet line with a plan of attack. Along with the buffet you can order their chocolate waffles, which were fantastic but too savory to eat on my own or their french toast----this was my favorite. It was in a pool of syrup and melted in my mouth, I like that. My only complaint was that the sweet potatoes and au gratin potatoes seemed a little under cooked and being a carboholic, that brought me down.  Save room for the pastries such as their Girl Scout Samoa cookie like macaroons (one may have magically slipped in a napkin for enjoyment later) or pumpkin muffins. They also had $4 Bloody Mary's and $3 Mimosas so start your Sunday morning....ehh...afternoon right and check this place out.

I had a great lunch experience .  Professional service. Food was absolutely amazing. I am giving 5 stars for the pricing .  I couldn't believe it you still can get something so delicious with a high class    under 10 dollars . Thank you. (I have submitted to pictures of Slow Raoasted Beef Brisket and Sea Scallops )

4.5, but worth it to round up.  If there's one thing you learn about Charlotte, it's not judging the merit of a business by its cover.  There are good restaurants in all kinds of shabby disguises here.  One of a few businesses in a strip mall type place near a Family Dollar, it would be very easy to just drive past La Bon in an effort to get to some of the more externally flashy, colorful places down Central. If it is a Sunday morning, that move would be a mistake. This was the kind of brunch buffet experience where I sat down with a plate of food and literally had to catch my breath because I couldn't seem to stop myself.  Everything we tasted was very good.  Superb standouts were the French toast, seasonal veggies, gratin potatoes, sweet potato hash and beef brisket. My husband's instinct is to wrinkle his nose at a 16$ brunch buffet but he had the same issue I had - inability to stop fork from going from plate to mouth over and over again.  He said it was possibly the best brunch he's ever had.  I'd say it was definitely the best I've had in Charlotte, and one of the best I've had period.  I'm telling you, I went from my current baby bump shape to a big old preggy belly shape in the course of an hour. The decor is comfortable and classy.  Service was pleasant and present so we had no issues there.  We went right after 10 AM when the place opens, so the big brunch crowd wasn't there yet but there was still some congestion at the buffet.  So the only thing detracting from a perfect is the slightly small size of the buffet.  I don't need more variety - focusing on a small set of offerings is probably part of why everything here is good - but more space would help. Bon appetit, bros.
Brunch was delicious and our server Julian was personable and attentive. He let us in before opening so we could have coffee instead of waiting outside in the cold.

Really great small plate options and delicious food. On the heavy side, but so worth it!  We had the saffron rice (superb! And favorite of the night), the octopus (not chewy at all and had a great sauce), the gnocchi (really delicious although heavy but I couldn't stop eating!), beer tartare (light and nice to have some veggies), and the mussels (had a slight corn reduction but was very good. It's also accompanied with bread so you can have more of that sauce).   I highly recommend this place! Right next to Yama!

Some of my favorite reviewers gave this place 4 stars, so I was happy about going out there today for a scheduled CMYE.  I've been gone almost five hours, and I'm still pissed.  I am not sure if I caught them on a bad day, or the fact that the reviews I respect are almost five months old.  Either way, "totally unimpressed" is the kindest thing I can say about both the place, and the CMYE. (I'll pan the CMYE later, if someone is silly enough to open a review page for it)  I approached the buffet table, and the first items I saw were what appeared to be some sort of beef and poultry.  Both absolutely sucked!  The beef was remarkably tender.  I like a braised/pot roast style beef as much as the next guy.  This beef was so overcooked, that had I tasted it blindfolded, I would not have been sure what I was eating.  The poultry was actually a bit slimy, and the flavor was mediocre at best.  I gathered from another review that one of the items I was eating was a black forest ham & pasta salad.  Really?!  As God is my witness, while I was eating it, I thought I was eating some sort of salmon concoction.  I remember seeing the words "black forest" taped to the sneeze guard.  I wondered to myself while eating, what is black forest about this salmon?!  No wonder!  It was ham!!  The potato gratin was both cold and flavorless.  The scrambled eggs might have been velvety five months ago.  The were clumped blech today.  The crispy bacon was cooked perfectly.  If it actually had any flavor, it might have been a saving grace.  The swedish meatballs were actually decent, and the sweet potato dish was pretty good, but for $21.00 (buffet, iced tea, and tip) I was actually longing for the Golden Corral.  I missed Howie, Terry, Michael, and Jimmy for this sh#t?!  Not a second time!!!!

Having worked in restaurants all over the city and even the Hollywood Brown Derby in Walt Disney World, I've come to have very high expectations for my food.  I am a college student, so I can't really afford to eat here regularly, but I took my girlfriend here for our anniversary and it was brilliant. The service staff was friendly, we were greeted by both the hostess and the bartender at the front, and despite being fully booked even to the lounge area out service was prompt and precise.  The Swedish meatballs are phenomenal, and the Brie Brûlée is nothing short of an orgasm for your pallet.  The only issue we had all night was that our waitress, although friendly, was pushing a bit too hard to sell us the more expensive items.  It took us saying that we were underage to get her to stop pushing their third most expensive bottle of wine.  Other than that minor issue, there are not many places in the city at which I would rather eat than Bistro.

I have been here for brunch and dinner.  This place is super close to a lot of other restaurants I've been to in the area and is tucked in neatly in the shopping center behind the CVS and is located right next to a brand new Ramen Shop, Yama Izakaya.  Bistro by far is my most visited dining establishment.  I love the friendliness of the staff as they're very attentive.  I forget his name but a waiter I've usually had is a dude with an awesome mustache.  Props man.  I had gone there for dinner and ordered a prime rib.  I seriously wish I could pan fry a prime rib like their chef did.  The bites I took seriously just burst with flavor.  It is a great place to take a date and can be optionally dressy or casual.  However you want.  I usually go there casual dressy.   If you haven't been here you should seriously reconsider your priorities.

I guess this place is better for brunch? Went here for dinner and had high expectations after seeing all the rave reviews on Yelp. The service was neglectful at best. The lamb was super disappointing, the octopus was decent, and the Swedish meatballs were definitely the highlight. I won't be back for dinner. Maybe someday I'll try their brunch.

Love this place. I have only done the Sunday brunch but all 3 times it was excellent.  The smorgasbord of food is endless and full of flavor. Yes - go to this place. The one catch I witnessed - large groups had to wait for check. Pick a day when your not in a hurry.  You want quick - in and out - go someplace else....I don't think this is a bad thing btw - its Sunday - chill the F out.

We can here for dinner and ordered the Spanish Saffron rice, Spanish grilled octopus, Brie Brûlée, Madras Mussels, Gnocchi and. Lychee martini. Everything was delicious! The lobster tail, shrimps, squid in the Saffron rice were fresh. The rice were fragrant with gingerly taste. The octopus were grilled perfectly and nicely seasoned. The plumped Mussels with curry sauce were fresh and tasty. The gnocchi was soft with light creamy sauce and the bite Brûlée was delicious!

One Word " YUMMERS" I finally made it here after having it bookmarked for months. After seeing it on the list of restaurants for restaurant week I decided to make reservations and finally give this place a shot. Dinner was awesome the only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because I was not impressed with the potato hash like substance that my salmon sat atop and the cramp space which caused server rear end on our table while taking the order of the table next to us. This meal was 4 courses which is rare during restaurant week. Course 1 We started with salads 1 yummy mixed greens salad with watermelon and a purée feta topping and 1 beet salad that was so tasty.  Course 2 Asparagus & avocado spring rolls as well as the fried Brussels. Both were amazing, I've never had Brussels that taste so good and the thought of asparagus mixed with avocado is yum-deli-umptious :-) Course 3 Scottish Salmon atop a potato like succotash. I wasn't a huge fan of the succotash but I did eat it. The salmon was PERFECT I ordered it medium Course 4 (Final course) Chocolate mouse and banana bread pudding with ice cream. Ooh my ooh my the bread pudding was EVERYTHING and then some.   This place is a hidden gem as I've driven past this parking lot heading to Soul Gastrolounge on numerous occasions and didn't notice this place. I'll be back to try the brunch with my family.

SUNDAY BRUNCH BUFFET  While there was nothing on this brunch menu that was the best, most interesting thing I've ever eaten, the food was solid and comforting and hit the spot.  Overall, I was entertained, and that's worth a good rating for me.    SALAD - I know, boring, right?  But the dressings were interesting and good.  I enjoyed the lemon dill vinaigrette.  JALAPENO MAC AND CHEESE - nice!  Stayed creamy even on the buffet.  The jalapenos gave a bit of flavor.    ASIAGO GRITS - I couldn't taste any cheese, but the grits were perfectly cooked.  POTATO GRATIN - I thought everything on the buffet needed a good amount of salt added, but that was easy enough for me to do myself.  The potatoes were what they were supposed to be.  Thin layers of potato in a creamy sauce.  Nothing earth shattering, but a nice staple.  BREADS - They keep a cranberry walnut bread, mini cranberry scone and nice sliced french bread on the buffet. This offering could have been greatly enhanced by adding some butter and jam.  The french bread was good, but the scone was dry and hard and the cranberry walnut bread also tasted a bit dried out.  Again, butter would have covered these issues.  PASTRIES - SO GOOD!!  The mini lemon tarts were fabulous.  Usually on tarts like that the dough is flavorless and often gets soggy, but this crust was perfectly sweet and crispy, and a nice foil to the tart lemon custard filling.  Coconut macaroons were crispy and sweet - absolutely what they should be.  Apple puff pastry was light and airy with a little crispiness to the flaky layers of dough and just enough filling to make it sweet and tasty.  CHOCOLATE WAFFLE - not totally sure this is worth the hype.  The waffle itself was a bit soft and the chocolate flavor clearly comes from the chocolate syrup on top.  The syrup was rich and dark tasting, and did make the waffle nice.  But not nice enough for me to waste more than one bite on it.  EGGS & BACON - The eggs were perfectly soft and scrambled, but the bacon was super limp and soggy.  Not ideal at all.  FRENCH TOAST - I'm not usually a fan, but surprisingly I enjoyed this french toast.  Warning: it comes out completely soaked in syrup.  We had two orders on our table.  One order was perfect, the other tasted way too egg-y.  But the delicious one was worth 4-5 stars.  MIMOSA - Strong and tasty and cheap!  $3  SERVICE -  A little spotty (not available) at times, but waiter was nice and pleasant.    ATMOSPHERE -  I love the casual but pretty interior here.  The buffet was a little painful to get to, as there was only one way to walk and that involved trying not to hit other diners heads or chairs and avoiding road block with another diner/waiter.    $20 Sunday Brunch buffet.  A bit pricey for what you get, but I enjoyed it nonetheless.

Been meaning to come to this place for awhile now. Cute ambience when you first walk in. The open kitchen is pretty neat. But then any good pretty much stops there. I'll try to simply state facts to avoid being rude here. My waiter reeked of cigarette smoke. The food was edible in the sense that nothing was burnt. My oysters were bland and undercooked, the shrimp dish barely had any shrimp and my mouth is shriveled up from all the salt. Good try Bistro La Bon but I'm no where near impressed.
LOVE. We have gone here for Sunday and Saturday brunch, the food and service cannot be beat. One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte
