Anyways, for me I rather go eat a vietnamese brunch on a Sunday spending a lot less for more variety and at the same time the healthy option is there for me to choose. Overall, I had a positive experience, but sadly this restaurant isn't quite my scene and brunch wise wasn't so great.

Great atmosphere and food. Never knew this place existed until Queen's Feast. Great food. Had the goat cheese stuffed peppers, potato gnocchi, filet and for dessert the cheesecake. Everything tasted wonderful and was prepared perfectly. Will definitely return.

When I was on this side of town, which is a rarity, someone I work with recommended this restaurant. I could not see that it was a restaurant until I walked through the door. The outside area was suspect. However, I was transported back to some of the best five star French meals I used to have in California. The scallops were great, the creme' brulee was the best I have ever had. My friend had great tips and chocolate cake, which she raved about. Service was great, waitress was accommodating and it had a pleasant atmosphere. I have been recommending it everywhere!
For me, this place is more function over form.  Wait staff is ifey, food is overly complex which results in a muddled taste.    Better restaurants in the immediate area, so for me - it is a pass..

Our first wine tasting at LaBon and it was a big hit. Wines were matched perfectly for us. Each course was excellent, delicious and generous. I would do this again in a heart beat. Servers and GM were efficient, friendly and professional.  A great night all the way around.  In the spirit of continuous improvement I would increase the time between courses, sometimes I felt that I couldn't keep up.  Also wine pours were plentiful.  Well done Miguel and team and to the Klinker Brick wine folks.

I work across from Bistro La Bon and have wanted to try it for a few months. We came here for Easter brunch (make a reservation ahead of time!) and it was fantastic. I'm not a huge breakfast person, so I was amazed at the wide variety of offerings at the buffet bar.   But oh my gosh. Get the French toast. Seriously. This is the BEST French toast I have ever had. I think everyone at my table ordered one, if not two, orders of it. It melts in your mouth.   While the service was great and the food selection was large, I will be returning solely for the amazing French toast.

Awesome Sunday Brunch..The buffet has everything from fresh fruit, to swedish meatballs, to cabbage and kielbasa to cheese grits. They also allow you to fresh to order French toast, chocolate waffles, eggs, bacon, and eggs Benedict. Everything was very good.

After hyping up Bistro la Bon to my girlfriend I was sorrily mistaken this evening. In the past the service was mediocre and this evening it was similar-- up until my girlfriends JUUL was taken from the table and internal components destroyed. We realized towards the end of the meal her $50 vape had gone missing. We searched around the table under and over with no results. After we've paid we ask the server whether he had seen it-- he said no but he would talk amongst the other employees. He returned to tell us none of the wait staff had seen the JUUL-- but he would check the trash. Come to find out from our waiter, the device had been washed in the dishwasher and was rendered useless-- as it no longer produces vapor. He apologized but that doesn't excuse destroying $50 considering that is 3/4 the cost of our meal. Displeased to say the least. I do not recommend coming here. Edit// In response to the manager I must say I am taken aback that you blame the situation on myself or my company. We left no such device behind, we indeed searched for it during our meal. We then walked to check in the car before inquiring about it as to not waste anyone's time. After searching the car for less than two minutes(never having left the establishment as we were parked around back) my girlfriend returned to ask our server John and I've already detailed above what occurred. I have seen the table wedges your referring to and they posses no similarities other then the fact they are dark colored. One is a rubber piece that is in the shape of a polyhedron while the other is a thin rectangle made of plastic. Appalled by your response considering I'm a business owner myself and the customer is always right. I will make sure to inform others of the downright lack of customer service and your refusal to accept responsibility for their actions.

We came here for brunch on Saturday, so there was unfortunately not a buffet. I had french toast with a side of eggs and a coffee with Baileys. While the french toast was nice and thick, the sweetness of the french toast and the coffee was a little much combined. There was also no powdered sugar on the french toast, which was a little disappointing.   My friend ordered a plate with english muffins, eggs, potatoes, and onions and it was delicious! I would definitely order that if I come back.

first time at bistro la bon. food was good. with one exception... i ordered the french toast and one side was almost burnt, with the other soggy and not cooked. other than that everything was actually fantastic. i thoroughly enjoyed the meatballs, kielbasa and cabbage was fantastic as well. and you cant be cheap brunch drinks as well.

Great food! Very tasty! I Had my birthday dinner there and had a great time. Price is a little pricey and the food is a little on the smaller portion size. However if you share dishes with friends then you would get full quite easily. Def recommend.
We did the Sunday brunch buffet. Not great. The French toast was ok. The eggs were runny and the bacon was thin. It seems like a nice ambience, though.

I popped in for Sunday brunch (1-25-15) and didn't have to wait thanks to having made reservations. Apparently there was a 20 to 30 minute wait when I arrived. This was at 11:45 so if you plan on coming with a group, plan ahead and make reservations!  The waiter informed us that there were no menus for the day. It's one price ($20) for the buffet and includes any small plates that you would like to order to have come out. Small plates include eggs & bacon, chocolate waffles, and others.   We ordered the chocolate waffles and eggs & bacon to come out to accompany our buffet picks. The portion of eggs was more than enough for me and my friend. The chocolate waffle was half the size of a 'typical' belgian waffle and yummy but I would have loved for it to have been just a tad warmer.  The buffet was filled with things such as swedish meatballs (thumbs up emoji), potato salad, cranberry relish, fruit, cookies, mini muffins, scones, and much more. Everything I sampled was delicious.   Bistro La Bon is a great place for a group because there is something for everyone. Plus $3 mimosas don't hurt :)

My fiancé and I walked into bistro labon without a reservation on a Friday night and were happily greeted and seated immediately. The atmosphere was nice , music was a great mix and there was a good crowd. Our waitress Alivia ( I'm probably spelling it wrong), was an absolute joy! My fiancé has many dietary restrictions and she took the time to suggest some alternative solutions to what they had on the menu for him. Needless to say everything she suggested for him and myself was excellent! The chef went out of his way to prepare something delicious that we both could enjoy! We were sure to let the manager know how much we appreciated the service we received here! We will definitely be back!
Tried brunch for the first time today. EXCELLENT!  Delicious meatballs and macaroni and cheese. Actually, everything was delicious.  Will definitely go back.

Last night I had one of the best meals of my life. I found out that Bistro La Bon,  a restaurant I've been wanting to try forever, has a 10 course tasting every Thursday. For $35pp you get 10 amazing courses, bigger portions than I thought too. The chef is so creative and I think this is his play time. He puts together ingredients you wouldn't think to but they turn out amazing.  I know the first two and last two plates, but I'm a little uncertain on the order in between.  1. Watermelon gazpacho that was unexpectedly (and delightfully) a little spicy 2. Fresh buffalo mozzarella with heirloom tomatoes, micro basil, and 12 yr balsamic 3. Goat cheese stuffed peppadew peppers with carmalized onions and a ginger honey sauce - this was a favorite 4. Seared scallop over mashed potatoes with demi glaze- dining partner said scallop was perfectly cooked. 5. Crispy avocado and asparagus with sweet chili sauce- another favorite 6. Salmon- don't remember much about it, I don't like seafood 7. Sweedish meatball and potatoes with ligonberry 8. Some kind of cream cheese whipped cream with ouzi? fruit- really good and very different 9. The most amazing cheese plate with a brie type cheese and apricot marmalade that went perfect together 10. Chocolate flourless cake with mango sorbet  The food was just to die for, but also the anticipation of what was coming next was really exciting. I can't wait to go back. It's different every week.
We went here for a date night and really enjoyed the food and drinks.  Will go back!

Quite the revelation. Especially if you remember the shopping center from the 80s and 90s. The Family Dollar a few doors down recalls the down market past, and even the Thomas Ave. funk of recent vintage is stepped up several notches with BLB's take on fine dining in the Plaza/Midwood corridor.  The space itself is surprisingly open, airy, and woody and makes good use of its corner location. The vibe is absolutely more upscale than neighbors like Dish, but not stuffy. That is plus for dinner service -- if it can find a sustainable market.  Both the wine and beer selections seemed well informed, a nice, caring touch. Apps skew toward a Mediterranean palate, but creatively so. Hence a Pan Seared Halloumi (cheese made from a mixture of goat and sheep milk) that won big fans and the duh, no-brainer in retrospect pairing of avocado & asparagus in a crunchy almost egg-roll deal. Strong flavors that stopped stop of overpowering.  Entrees show an inflection point. The Swedish meatballs are huge faves and stretch from the popular Sunday brunch to the dinner menu. Fine. But the specials struck me as particularly creative and well-executed. A cumin and caraway encrusted rack of lamb on a bed of pearl couscous and peas managed to be both rich and very light. And halibut catch of the day was a tremendous example of seafood prepared simply -- without gobs of butter or cheap wine trying to mask the flavor. Or salt. Had to have been one the most lightly salted prepared meals I've had in a long time. Wonderful.  The inflection comes with the price -- $26 for the lamb, $29 for the halibut. Totally and completely worth it for any remotely serious diner. But also pushing the tab to a $50 per person price point that I am not entirely certain the corridor can support (although it should.) Interesting, our server mentioned that they were moving to more of a tapas-style small plate approach -- which is usually a sign that owners are afraid they are pricing themselves out of a market and hope to make up the difference on alcohol. (Must note that across the parking lot neighbor Soul Gastrolounge does do a big biz on the tapas/small plate/sushi tip.)  Aping that approach would be a shame as BLBs top tier fine dining entrees really do set BLB apart from anything in East Charlotte.
Great food & happening atmosphere. Excellent selection of wine. Exceptional service.

This was honestly one of the best brunch places I've ever been-- but definitely the best brunch in Charlotte! Brunch here entails unlimited food that you serve yourself as well as ordering from the chef's menu of the day. My favorite part of my brunch definitely has to be the rice and chicken at the serve yourself area as well as the French toast that I ordered from the chicken. I went here with a friend and we were both very satisfied! Definitely will be coming back.

Well done bistro la bon, you have fulfilled all my expectations! We had the frito misto, mussles & fritas, and the potato gnocchi. All were very good but I enjoyed the mussels & fries the most like who ever thought? Mussels and fries .. and cheese on top woah! The decor also caught my eye, I LOVE THE ANTIQUE CHAIRS, very nice vibes! Honestly I couldn't decide between 4 or 5 stars but I'm leaning towards so 5 so why the heck not! My only complaint would be the frito misto, it was okay it just tasted like calamari in tomato sauce. Service AWESOME, Food GREAT(they have small plates hollaaa), Decor LOVE..Im really looking forward to come back & try out their brunch! (;
Filet was cooked perfectly. Every bite was medium rare. I enjoyed desert, and had an over all pleasant experience. Stephan was a delightful and insightful waiter.

First timer - Went for a group brunch on a Saturday at noon. The Bloody Mary's were amazing! Nice kick from the NC mix! And, the eggs Benedict were probably the best I've ever had. Can't wait to go back for their buffet!
We were told a one hour wait ... With no one in the waiting area. And the hostess was incredibly rude and unhelpful. Such a disappointment

Great food, great atmosphere for a celebration. We came here with a group of 8 or so for my mother in laws birthday and had a great time. The small plates were all delicious for the most part, and the wait staff did a great job staggering things so that we had a nice flow of items for the table to try. The chef/owner even sent us a bottle of sparkling wine for a birthday toast which we definitely appreciated. Eclectic but cool decor and a great vibe for dinner, I'd definitely recommend.

Loved the Sunday brunch.  Everything was very tasty.  Lots of different dishes - not your traditional breakfast foods.  Oh they have scrambled eggs and bacon.  But, they also have beets and kale salad, salmon lox, kielbasa and cabbage, etc. etc.  My only complaint is that we had a large group and the restaurant added a 20% tip / gratuity.  Service was okay, but not worth 20%.
I visited this place a little while ago.  I forgot to post my review.  The brunch was good.    Con: Not enough room for the patrons.  The price is a little over the top for this area.

Had a lovely brunch with a friend at this spot. Let's talk about al line details! To begin, this place is super easy to find. It's located on the corner of a shopping center off Central Ave. there is a big bright white sign with black letters-- you can't miss it. As you walk up, you get a good idea about the decor of the establishment, it's cute and chic.   Upon our arrival, a sever asked that we be seated in his section- and he was a pretty awesome server. He provided us with just the right amount of attention. The service was both prompt and courteous.   In regards to the food I enjoyed it, although it was not exceptionally memorable. I had the spinach and caramelized  onion Benedict. My friend had the fresh biscuit and turkey with gravy. We also enjoyed the $3.00 mimosas- yes that is correct $3.00!!!  This place is a winner in my book because the service is too notch, prices are good? Ambiance is adorable, and the food is decent!

Seriously it's that bad that I am literally reviewing the restaurant before even paying the tab. Why is this listed at a top place for brunch? It wasn't even crowded. waitress could use an upgrade.   Place opens at 10 and we were sat at 12. Already sold out of steak so we all got breakfast burgers. They messed up our orders of "done ness" my medium went to the girl that wanted it well done.   No siracha after waitress offered it to us.  No almond or soy milk.  No fresh squeezed juice  No true Bellini (peach champagne and oj)

Maybe it was because I had no expectations that I was blown away by this place but regardless I was.  We actually planned to go to another restaurant but because we were trying to make a concert, and that place had over an hour wait and didn't take reservations we had to change our plans.  Thank god we did.    I think it was a special, but if they have the Duck confit and you don't get it then we just can't be friends.  The mussels also have no business being in Charlotte.  Mussels that good, you need to be on the bay, they are that fresh.  The server was VERY knowledgeable and very helpful with the menu.  We let him make recommendations and we just sat back and enjoyed.  I will be coming back again as soon as humanly possible.

Great for Sunday brunch. The buffett has something for everyone. Also, you can special order traditional menu items - omelettes, French toast, chocolate waffles etc. - from the kitchen at no extra cost. Some of the buffet food items dos not appeal to me but enough options for all palates. It's Southern and eclectic.  Between the people and the music it would be hard to hear for some people in this environment. It's noisy and festive at brunch. Service is attentive.  Come at 11:45 am to get the best brunch table and beat the crowds. Bloody Mary's and mimosas start at noon.

Went for the Sunday brunch buffet. Excellent food and service. The buffet had a lot of items from fresh fruits and salads to Brisket, kielbasa and cheese grits and smoked salmon.... highly recommended

Yikes, where to begin.  Went here for Valentine's Day with the little lady, and the delivery fell way short of our expectations.  Really it was our server, who was terrible and pretty much ruined the whole experience.  Make no mistake, the food was great.  But I was legitimately concerned that lucifer himself was going to claw his way out of her snarky attituded body.  I was disappointed in the lack of variety offered by the menu, half priced bottles of wine on Valentine's Day is great and all, but I like options.  There were about 8 entrees to choose from.  Again though, despite our server, food was good.  HOWEVER, I will never go back here, or ever recommend to anyone else to go here.  Take it for what you will and good luck.

I went here for lunch because of the good reviews on Yelp. I was certainly surprised in the location of this restaurant. I figured it would be in an upscale environment, but it was on the end of a strip mall that featured a Family Dollar. Inside was a nice bar area, and the dining area was an "industrial" looking dining room with exposed brick and ductwork. Service was good (our waiter was friendly but it seemed a bit forced) and it was prompt. Now the food was pretty good. The Jalapeño Mac & Cheese was pretty good. It had a nice creamy texture and had just enough spice to open the flavor up but not overpower it. Also the Salmon Benedict was very flavorful, and the eggs were poached perfectly! (always a plus).  Another plus is the Bloody Mary, You order your drink and they bring you a glass of vodka of your choosing in a little ice and then you get to go to the bar and choose your own mixers, spices, veggies, etc. I must admit I make a pretty dang good Bloody Mary!

First off, wanted to say that this review is based upon their brunch, which is delicious!  If you are hungry, this is the spot.  The hot bar is mostly lunch items.  There is a random array of kielbasa, salads, potatoes, cheese grits etc....There are a ton of muffins and breads.  They do cook to order breakfast food which has options of eggs and bacon, french toast and waffles.  On to what I love....the cook to order french toast and waffles!  The waffles has a fresh whipped cream that is decadant.  The french toast is flavorful and moist.  But what i love the most....the MACAROONS!  I have been known to grab a few on the way out!  Tacky, I know, but I can't get enough!  If you are a drinker, $2 mimosas are tempting!  The brunch is $18 per person.  If you are hungry and are interested in a an all-you-can eat brunch in Plaza Midwood, this is the spot!

I try to not give low rated reviews and usually just don't bother for places that I don't care to go back to. I am re-reviewing and giving Bistro La Bon a low rating for the reason that we were very dissappointed with the food after I had given the restaurant 5 stars about a year ago. The menu have changed. Yes, I know and expect restaurants to change their menu to reflect change in seasonal produce, etc. The portions of the tapas have gotten smaller. Yes, I know tapas are small plates. However, we felt the dishes were way over-priced for the portion and quality. Our bill for 3 ppl (only one alcoholic drink) was close to $150 and my husband was still hungry afterwards. The waiter did bring us a complimentary 2nd plate of lamb shank because he said the first plate of one lamb shank was small. Side note- we did not complain at all, the waiter brought it out on his own initiative. Even with a free plate, Bistro is not worth it for us to drive over there. Sorry. My son remembered how great their seared scallop dish was so we ordered a scallop dish. Scallops were smaller size this time around.

I feel really torn about writing this review because the dishes we had were really different.   Specifically, the pan seared potato gnocchi was absolutely transcendent. I mean, it was moan-worthy!!! 6 stars out of 5.   The waiter also recommended the calamari, but it wasn't that great. 2 stars. Too salty, and just really not anything special. (Did we eat it all? Yes, ok? We are those people.)  Finally, my date ordered the saffron veggie risotto, and I didn't like it at all! I'm not a super picky person, but the dish wasn't good. 1 star.   I definitely need to go back and try out some other dishes to see if they have anything else that matches the gnocchi.
Fun atmosphere. Good Salmon.   Live guitar music was very nice.   Worth a try.  Enjoyed the meal.   Very good service.
Food was okay, the food itself wasnt hot. The pyrtipanni or whatever it's Swedish dish was, had "ribeye" meet that was closer to stew meat. Drinks were good and so was the service.

Good but not great. Good selection on the buffet including wonderful dessert table. Not very consistent in terms of taste and quality. The best: French Toast. Chocolate Waffle. The worst: bacon, cabbage and polish sausage. The meh: eggs Benedict, grits, au grautin potatoes.  Great service. Not worth going out if your way for this one!!

I would have to say this is the best place to eat in Charlotte, the food has been great every time, it has many seasonal fresh type dishes with a smaller menu, but everything on there, is very good.   The saturday breakfast and sunday brunch are the shining stars though.  The chocolate waffle. Best ever.

We come here often as we live nearby. Great vibe, great food. Entrees available, but I always enjoy their tapas menu.  Tonight we tried a few new items and I can't say enough about the gnocchi. Creamy Parmesan sauce with spinach and artichokes. Hands down the best I have ever had.  Ended up dipping my roasted cauliflower in the gnocchi sauce....so so good! Come by and enjoy!!

Having been to some of the finest restaurants in the world, Bistro La Bon rates as one of the best meals I have had in a long, long time.  The fusion of Continental and Swedish cuisine provides for a remarkably uncommon fusion.  Having experienced a tasting menu at the Chef's personal direction, I was able to sample 7 courses complete with a  divine triptych dessert plate...  Each one excellent in its own rite.  The staff provides incredible service while the interior provides a warm unfussy ambiance perfect for any occasion.  The wine selection compliments the cuisine both in quality as well as price-- unbelievable!  Had I still lived in the Queen City, Bistro La Bon would be new weekly craving.  Hats off to Chef Majid Amoorpour!

So we don't get to Charlotte often, and I asked a few friends what they would recommend as a restaurant there, since we were going to IKEA and wanted to have something nice before heading home.  I looked around on Yelp as well, and found that there was one place that everyone seemed to agree was good.  We found the place, a little off the beaten track in an area that seems to be undergoing some, gentrification, let's say.  In a grocery store parking lot next to a 5 Guys burgers.  Once inside, this place immediately transported us to Paris.  A rustic chic, comfortable and quiet, with little nooks for the individual sections.  Our waiter, Trip (he asked that we mention him by name, and I'm more than willing to do so, because he rocked ;)) seated us by the window, and immediately made us feel comfortable and welcome.  We decided to make the best of the menu and worked our way through the small plates, sharing each one. We started off with what would turn out to be the best plate of the evening, a warm and delightful Frito Misto, with a combination of perfectly deep fried calamari and shrimp, tossed in a savoury tapenade of nicoise olives, tomatoes and banana peppers, simply heavenly.  We continued on our culinary journey with a wonderful bite of Lavender Chicken, then on to the Seared Scallops.  Delightful, the hazelnut crumb was the perfect bit of texture for the sweet bits of seafood.  The next item on the seafood side of this was the Shrimp and Chorizo.  I don't like chorizo, well, I didn't like chorizo.  What I was expecting, when I ordered it more to please my spouse, who enjoys the spicy, greasy stuff, was exactly that.  What I got instead, was delicately sliced and just enough to send a spicy flair through the creamy sauce that provided the base for beautifully prepared shrimp.  Melt in the mouth..as Manu would say.  (You'd have to be a fan of Aussie TV to get that one)  By the time the Pan Seared Gnocchi arrived, I was already getting a bit full to appreciate the rather heavy dish, but the flavours were spot on, and the hubby certainly dug in.  The only dish that I regret ordering, was the Butternut Squash Lasagna, it lacked salt and the love in preparation that was evident in the rest of the savoury dishes.  Now, we couldn't very well leave without dessert, so we chose what our waiter, the ever attentive and knowledgeable Trip, suggested, the Brioche Bourbon Bread Pudding.  Bread pudding, in my experience is often the result of leftovers from last week's table bread.  Bread pudding in this instance, was light, creamy and a joy to taste, the homemade vanilla ice cream (complete with little black flecks of vanilla bean) the bourbon soaked raisins, and ooooh yes, that completely heavenly caramel sauce, liftingt to heights never before reached by the simple bread pudding.  So, all in all, a big high 5 and thumbs up to both Bistro La Bon, and the awesome Trip! We'll be back the next time we want to spend money at IKEA..soon..yup ;)  https://yourfoodieguru.wordpress.com/

Good heavens I love this place!!  It has replaced all others as my TOP Charlotte restaurant.  Love the location right near Uptown - and very easy to find parking.  There is a nice outdoor patio with awesome wood furniture and fun swings (I don't think they function as swings - more as benches...)  The interior is beautiful with a gorgeous sweeping bar and bar area in front.  We try to get the couches in the front to eat our dinner.  If you are feeling more formal though go ahead and sit in the back with the nicer tables and chairs.  The food here is DIVINE!!  The pepperdew app is my fav - so simple and delicious.  The gnocchi is another favorite, such a simple and tasty dish.  We have had just about everything on the menu.  Prices are very reasonable and the service is always stellar.  Can't wait to be back!!

The price is good ($22) but the food was alright. You can do menu or buffet for same price. I wasn't overall impressed with brunch choices. Service was good. Compared to the other places you go in CLT where you can get mimosas included...this place doesn't cut the mustard. It's a last resort for me and I don't plan to go back for brunch; maybe lunch/dinner is better.

Thank you fellow Yelpers for helping me find this location. I was in town visiting family and looking for a Sunday brunch restaurant. Yelp to the rescue! We arrived at Bistro la bon around 10:30 am. I'm glad because we avoided the incoming rush of people. Everything about this place was great from the food, service and decor. The Sunday brunch buffet is $22 which is pricey but worth the money.  Our server Joshua was great at explaining the brunch experience. All the food is organic, farm to table, no preservatives. You can order eggs, bacon, eggs Benedict , French toast and chocolate waffles. They even made me an order of egg whites. All the food options were great. I hope they add turkey bacon or sausage to their menu. Although they do offer biscuits & gravy with turkey meat.   We had a group of five. The seating was chairs and a long bench. The seating was a little tight but we made it work. Even though I don't live on Charlotte anymore I would definitely return during another visit.

So sad to post this since I was really looking forward to eating here, the host sat us down and we waited for 30 minutes and nobody came to take our order or even ask if we've been helped. Sorry that's very unacceptable especially since we're all working on tips.

Easily in my top 5 restaurants in Charlotte. The Mussels are to die for! I can always count on this place for being consistently awesome and is always the first restaurant i take any guests from out of town to impress them. As for brunch...don't even get me started. It's Heaven in a buffet.  You just can't lose with this place.
Came here for a brunch Tinder date if you can believe that. Food was very good, though kind of pricey for $22 pp.

Great service, great food. It was my first time visiting Charlotte from Boston and what struck me about this city is that there is a seemingly endless supply of restaurants and bars. I ate out A LOT on that trip and Bistro La Bon was one of the best.
Great tapas restaurant.  We went on New Year's eve and had a wonderful time. Great prices too!

My boyfriend and I went for restaurant week the other night. The food was great (grilled octopus, scallops, bread pudding, to highlight a few), and the waiter was trying really hard to add to the experience. Sometimes more successfully than others. My boyfriend upgraded to the filet, and really liked it, but it wasn't exactly a man-sized-appetite portion for the extra $$. Also, he said it wasn't as good as Del Friscos. Which was pretty easy to counter with "well, steak is their specialty"...so I would caution you to manage your expectations. We saw friends there who said the chicken was phenomenal. Maybe try that.  Atmosphere is a good for a date or small group. A large group (8+) would consume the place and raise the noise level, possibly ruining the experience for others.   The brunch is outstanding and probably the best in the city (way better than that crap Nan & Byron's tries to pass off as upscale). Absolutely worth the price.

Bordered by a beauty supply store, a uniform shop, and Family Dollar, Bistro reigns as a diamond in the rough. Upon entering the unassuming storefront, you are transported into a charming interior befit for  celebrations.  I came here on a lazy Sunday for an anniversary brunch. I was a little skeptical at first as I usually associate buffets with eating sub-par food from troughs, hangovers in Las Vegas, and those trays of nasty scrambled eggs that are somehow runny despite being overcooked.  This brunch is no buffet but rather a self-described smorgasbord that will far exceed your expectations.  Note: NO mimosas before noon on Sunday (Thank you Chapter XIV of the1741  North Carolina General Assembly). But when they do come, they come cheap and strong (only $3!) ;)  Service: our server was on-point. Very attentive and gracious with refilling the coffee (I hate few things more than ordered the bottomless coffee that never gets refilled).   Bacon: Bewarned, one order of bacon contained about 6 stripes of perfectly fried crunchy bacon. I warn you because you will eat all of them despite your hardest efforts. Take it easy there!  French Toast: thick, fluffy, and sweet. Just the way I like it.  Chocolate Waffles: nice as a novelty, but considering all of the other delectable options I'll save my room for the smorgasbord next time.   The smorgasbord itself is an array of awesome. Swedish meatballs that would make IKEA blush, rich potato gratin, juicy beef brisket, the list goes on. There is nothing on there that I didn't get twice. The only thing that we wanted for was cream cheese for the salmon and bread.  Be seeing you soon!

Out of this world brunch! French toast, eggs, bacon and chocolate belgium waffles to order from the kitchen. The buffet continues with cheese, scones, fresh fruit, strawberries, cantaloupe, watermelon and a salad bar. They also have Swedish meatballs. Have dessert including coconut macaroons and apple strudel. Hot coffee, great service!

You know that time you went to a restaurant and said to yourself "wow, this place is so good!  I have to come back."?  That's me and Bistro La Bon.  I've only ever been here for dinner.  Each time, the food has been fantastic and the service a bit slow.  My recommendation:  Perfect place for a date, double date, group catch-up or guests out of town that you're looking to impress.  You want an amazing meal without the wait staff coming around too often.  Last night, I went for restaurant week.  It didn't disappoint.  The beet/apple salad with a few dabs of white sauce was inventive.  Gnocchi and brussel sprout dishes for the second course were fantastic.  Both sauces were absolutely delicious and flavorful.  The Sweedish Meatballs and Lavender Chicken for the main courses were both awesome.  I'm a huge Sweedish Meatball fan...these were larger than Ikea size with more flavor.  Lavender Chicken was really flavorful and light.  I highly recommend this dish if you're having a heavier meal.  Best part was the chocolate dessert and the bread pudding.  Both absolutely fantastic...like so good that we didn't have room left in our stomachs after the main course, but managed to lick the dessert plates clean.  Drinks were pretty good, and I recommend ordering off the cocktail menu.  I'm a huge Cucumber fan so I recommend the Cucumber Gimlet.  Recommendation...if you don't want to do a huge meal, this is a PERFECT place to meet for drinks/apps.  They have a really cool bar area and front patio where you can sit and have a drink with a friend or date.

I had a wonderful experience here brunch. The staff is extremely fast despite how busy the restaurant was at noon. The food was delicious!! I enjoyed the French toast, eggs Benedict, and the Swedish meatballs the most. However, all the options were incredibly good. I will definitely be back! I've also come here for dinner and enjoyed the experience & food.

Came here for brunch with my lil Cuz.. We're from Atlanta and wanted to chill and eat so we ended up here. It was pretty good.   Had the brunch buffet.. The meatballs were bomb. Curry cauliflower was good. My cousin lived the salmon n capers. The eggs Benedict were good too. Everything else was just basic.

One of my favorite restaurants in charlotte! Service is amazing and the food is always great. Potato gnocchi, crispy avocado & asparagus, and risotto are my favorites. Lots of veggie options - the staff is very accommodating to vegetarian diets. My husband and I even ate dinner here on our wedding day :)
I love this place! The owner usually takes the time to stop by and say hello, the entree choices are creative and yummy. I feel like we don't take the time to visit often enough. Great ambiance!

It's so dark in here. I can't see shit. Really though it's like I'm in a cave. I literally need to use a flashlight to navigate. It's a delicious cave though, with delicious food.   Don't come here with less than a half-moon.

I ordered the airline chicken fettuccine and it tasted like fish. Obviously the chicken was cooked on the same grill as the fish. I was I was very disappointed. This was my second visit to the restaurant and it will be my last.
Bread pudding was amazing. And the made to order French toast is hard to beat. Great place for brunch with friends. Wish there were options for salad dressing though.

This has been our favorite spot for years! Had a wonderful dinner here last night, before heading to a show. Once again, we loved everything about it! Ambiance was wonderful, food was amazing, and the service was impeccable...thank you, Wes!

Having come here twice now I'm officially a fan.  Both times visiting my girlfriend and I have only eaten on the large couches up front so I can't speak to specifics of the formal dining area however I would recommend any small party of 2 to 4 eat up in the front or bar area.  From outside looking into the formal dining area I think the bar or front lounge is just more relaxing and entertaining of an environment to dine.  The food here is just superb.  The meat and cheeses and all the small plates are divine.  The peppadew (sp) is probably my favorite.  It has just the right amount of heat and spice and is surprisingly filling.  The wine specifically is affordable which is nice if you're not trying to break the bank on dinner.    The staff is very polite and always attentive.

It took me a while to get around to trying Bistro La Bon, but now I've been twice.  The interior is beautiful, service is that wonderful combination of unobtrusive yet omnipresent that makes everything flow smoothly.  The wine list makes me happy and has plenty of options for ordering by the glass.  The coffee has me asking "why does the coffee at my house not taste this good?"  The food is worth coming back to try more of.  I've never thought of Swedish meatballs as anything special, but they're a highlight of the menu, as is the flourless chocolate cake.  And there was some kind of squid-ink risotto thing that I'm remembering fondly now, too.  And despite what some of the other reviews say, this stretch of Central is far from the seediest place you'll ever have to park in Charlotte.  You'll be quite safe.

I meet a friend out here last minute because the other restaurant we planned on going to had a 45 minute wait. I am SO glad she suggested trying this place instead. She said it was good and I was open to trying something new!  And when I tell you everything was delish, EVERYTHING WAS DELISH!!! Oh my goodness this is a great place for a vegetarian to visit!! This is my new spot to go for a yummy drink and great appetizers!! We ordered the Vegetarian Lasagna, Brussel Sprouts and Mussels with a Watermelon mojitos!! This drink was so chic and gorgeous with the watermelon wedge on the side, I couldn't wait to taste it and it was amazing!!  The food was wonderful as well, my favorite out of the three that we ordered was the Brussel sprouts, it had this sauce, that was out of this world!! It was so delicious I would go back just for the Brussel Sprouts! Secondly, would be the Mussels, which had french fries on top! The sauce under the mussels was mouth-watering as well. It had a spicy kick to it, but not too overpowering, just the right kick! Thirdly, of course the Lasagna, but only because I had to place it somewhere not because I didn't enjoy it. If I had taken a picture of my plate after I finished, it would be shameful how I cleaned that plate!  The service was good, the vibes from the bartender was a little off but overall everything was excellent! I can not wait to go back. I'll be planning a Ladies Night soon:)
One of the best brunches of your life. Cool eclectic awesome tastiness at the buffet, plus eggs, bacon and waffles or pancakes cooked to order. It's different every time and that makes it WOW!

If nothing else, Bistro gets my vote for Charlotte's ugly duckling award.  Who knew a strip mall best known for it's Dollar General and its proximity to the train tracks could turn out such a pleasant little restaurant with the promise to become something great?  Made it out here for brunch last week with the wife and a mutual couple friend after reading all the Yelp reviews that told me not to judge by the exterior of Bistro. So glad I listened to them!  First off, I'm not a big fan of buffets at any time of the day, but a breakfast buffet especially reminds me of Shoney's and its Big Boy mascot who tried to teach me as a youngin' that french toast can actually be made as identical strips that are uniform in texture and color.  Luckily, Bistro made a believer out of me.  It probably helps that the waffles and french toast come made to order direct to your table along with eggs and bacon served family-style.  The buffet was a great mix of fresh fruits and salads, and then a number of hot dishes for both those meat-lovers amongst us and our more vegetarian friends.  I skipped the meats completely and was more than full on the roasted vegetables, sweet potato hash, fresh fruit, and the wide selection of baked pastries and breads on the sideboard.  However, I am told the roast was wonderful.   I also liked the fact that the head chef was constantly outside of the kitchen monitoring the buffet for himself.  He made a point to ask myself and other diners if we had any questions about any of the dishes.  Now that's service and the kind of thing that shows me this buffet is not going solely for maximum volume of food.    And did I mention the $3 Mimosa specials with brunch?  Seriously can't find much to bicker with here.  Just make sure your dining companions are either local or get a prep talk that you're not taking them to Sketchville for a hobo meal.  This ugly duckling is a swan inside.

I'm guessing by the reviews left previously for this bistro that Charlotte doesn't have much of a dining scene, as I was not overly impressed by La Bon.  I should say upfront that we went for the Sunday brunch, which is *only* all-you-can-eat buffet for $20. Guess we should have done our research as a) neither of us was $20 hungry and b) the buffet was very limited with just a few items (meatballs, mac and cheese, kielbasa, pastries). Definitely not a $20 buffet. And on top of that, the coffee and orange juice were extra ($4 each). So we each paid $24 for a drink and a piece of French toast.  That's not to say I wouldn't go back on a Saturday when you can order a la carte (which is what they should also offer on Sunday) but I would not recommend the Sunday brunch as it's just mediocre for a kind-of-high-price-tag.

A wonderful gem in a rough setting. I have had lunch, brunch, and supper and have enjoyed each.  The service is always attentive and chatty, while not overwhelming.  The decor is comfortable with a nod towards more formal dining.  When very crowded, however, the concrete floors and mostly hard surfaces do make for something of an echo chamber.  The brunch Sunday afternoons is lovely, with a great variety of meats, pastas, fruit, and baked goods.  The shortbread/biscuits are not to be missed.  My other favorite is the brisket, which is odd, given that I am not much of a meat eater.   It is positively fork tender and rests in its own delicious juice.  They also cook to order french toast (VERY custardy) and chocolate waffles (which I liked fine despite usually not being much of a chocolate person).  There is often a line for brunch.  For lunch throughout the week, they offer a reasonable selection of small plates, entrees, and desserts.  Supper is more expensive, but still a good value for what you receive.  My other half is a vegetarian, and the chef gladly prepared something to his taste when asked (and it was quite good).  I've tried every variation of dessert they offer and have loved each.  Overall, this is my favorite restaurant on my end of town.
Absolutely Love this place for brunch on the weekends. Make the time to go in and order the French toast.

Eclectic artsy restaurant located in the plaza Midwood area. It's in the shopping center with parking available on the end of the shopping center. Came in on a week night for restaurant week. Upon entering I was immediately greeted had a seat at the bar until the rest to my party arrived. I was provided to drink menu and decided to try their blanc drink. It was very light and not too sweet. As the rest of my party arrived we transitioned to the table or dinning area smoothly. I had the shrimp churro as an appetizer which was wonderful. I sampled a bit of the Brussels sprouts which were seasoned well. Then  I had the surf and turf as my entrée. The texture quality and taste were really good. For dessert I had the espresso cream Brûlée. The cream brûlée did not  have a nice crisp top. The espresso didn't mix right with this dish it was very overbearing.  I did not quite enjoy the desserts. I was able to sample the other desserts that people at my table ordered. The bread pudding was more like a cake texture and wasn't as soft, but crunchier.  The plate that it was served on was very large. The chocolate cake was okay. The presentation was great and the manager walked around brining out dishes and asking how everything was going. I think it's a great place to go to and I probably return.

This is exactly how Swedish Meatballs should taste! Majid has hit the mark perfectly. We tried a lot of different small plates and everything from the Lavender Chicken to the Samosas was exquisite. Highly recommend. We are coming back for the the brunch tomorrow.

Love this place went once and it was amazing second time I went wasn't as good and they said it was a different chef and the food tasted night and day from the first time. If you go hopefully you get the great chef highly recommend his cooking.

Bistro La Bon is a solid choice for Sunday brunch.  We walked in around 11am and were warmly greeted by the hostess. We waited less than ten minutes for a table to open up, and were seated in the middle of the restaurant.   Our server came over to greet us and explained how brunch works there; there's a plentiful buffet near the front of the restaurant, and there are a handful of dishes made-to-order that you can request at no additional cost. We each ordered an additional breakfast item with a side of bacon, and the kitchen put all of our orders of bacon on one plate. What a sight to see a heap of bacon delivered to your table!  The made-to-order dishes were fine; they seemed as though they'd been sitting for awhile before they were brought to the table, as the  the hollandaise sauce was cold.   The buffet, though, was quite nice. There was a nice assortment of fruit, salads, proteins, and desserts. I loved the sausage and cabbage being served by the kitchen window and ended up going back for seconds and thirds. The coconut macaroons on the dessert table were perfect. I enjoyed more than my fair share of those.  I would definitely return for brunch, and I'd like to make my way here for dinner, too. Our group had a very pleasant experience and left satisfied.

One of my favorite places in Charlotte! Everything was topnotch. The service was amazing, my father-in-law has recently had some heart problems and is required to have a sodium free diet. We informed the server of his dietary restriction and she informed the chef. There was not a lot on the menu that they c made him something special and with food items that he truly enjoyed. We will be back!

My boyfriend and I came here for date night tonight and we've also been in the past with friends. The drinks are ALWAYS outstanding and the food is even better. But tonight our server was Ishah, and she was amazing. Super attentive, helpful with drink & food menus and very down to earth. Thanks, Ishah!!!!

Went to Bistro for NYE dinner. It was AMAZING!!!! I had the steak which was perfectly cooked and delicious, and my fiancé had the lamb which he really enjoyed. I would definitely eat here for dinner again and am glad we gave it another shot after the brunch left a lot to be desired.

I continue to place Bistro La Bon in my top-5 Charlotte restaurants. Last night was no exception. Prior to a concert at Ovens, my friend and I split the bone-in rib eye special that came with whipped potatoes, broccoli and sauteed mushrooms. My friend likes medium and I like medium rare so we asked if they could cook to a "happy medium." The grill chef totally hit it - perfect. Our server was great as well. I cannot think of a better choice for dining last night than Bistro La Bon.

The Charlotte cuisine scene is headed in the right direction with Bistro la Bon.    Had a good time here recently, and the food was good (for Charlotte).  The tuna crudo appetizer wasn't very memorable, but it wasn't bad either.  The duck main course was something I could've cooked at home, so it wasn't something that stood out much.  Still, it was a good meal.  For dessert, I had the recommended bread pudding.  I am a huge fan of bread pudding, and was surprised to find their bread budding less "bready" and more creamy.  Definitely order this.  The service was very friendly and on point, and not obtrusive nor insincere.    Go and give this place a try.  It's definitely much better than most places in Charlotte, which tends to be all about comfort food, or what I've recently read, "frat-boy comfort food" -- an apt description for the restaurants in this city.
Always come by whenever I'm in Charlotte. Excellent service, and I can't stop thinking about the lavender chicken

Loved my experience here for Queen's Feast: Charlotte Restaurant Week (Jan 2017). Bistro La Bon had one of the best restaurant week menus out there, which included 4 courses for $35 per person.   For my first course, I started with the Kale Salad while my boyfriend had the Roasted Beet and Apple salad. I like kale, but I did think the kale salad was a little bitter and the flavors didn't integrate as well as I'd hoped. But not bad enough to knock stars off this review.  For the second course, I ordered the Grilled Spanish Octopus with roasted ratatouille, citrus aioli. YUM! If you like octopus (it's a little chewy). My boyfriend had the Crispy Avocado & Asparagus roll with sweet chili tamarind balsamic and he really appreciated the freshness in the texture and taste.  For the third course, we both ordered the Lavender Chicken over banana bread, walnuts, grapes, curry sauce. WOW! What awesome flavor combinations! The chicken was so well cooked and everything was just so satisfying.  For dessert, we also both ordered Bourbon Brioche Bread Pudding with house-made caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream. HECK NO, I wasn't gonna share! A-Mazing.  We also each enjoyed a glass of red wine that the waiter recommended.  Also to note, it was easy to make a reservation (through Yelp) and we were seated upon arrival. Despite being restaurant week, Bistro La Bon wasn't crowded or noisy.

Nice atmosphere, great food. We didn't make a reservation online like we should have so they said the wait would be an hour but it was around 30 mins. They have a nice seating area with comfy couches to qait so we didn't mind. We were seated outdoors and it was nice. The food was really great. We loved everything. I can't think of a single thing we didn't like. Even my super picky brother in law gave it a thumbs up. We all had the brunch buffet and tried about everything on the buffet as well as the made to order items. We really likes the french toast, choc waffles, au gratin potatoes, eggs benedict (the egg was perfect!) Bread pudding, meatballs, Mac and cheese and grits..... Those are the things that come to mind first. But really everything was so good. Nothing prepackaged, all very nice, delicious, well prepared food.

My husband and I enjoyed a nice dinner at Bistro La Bon. Service was great, the food was delicious, and atmosphere was cozy. We began by sharing a small plate, the crispy avocado asparagus spring rolls. They were surprisingly good, crunchy, and not oily. For dinner I had their equivalent of paella and my husband had one of the salmon dishes. For dessert we shared the upside down apple cake served with pumpkin gelato. I look forward to trying Brunch sometime soon.

When I was 16 I had my car broken into outside of Bistro La Bon when it wasn't Bistro La Bon. Now, 8 years later, I ventured in this morning to try out their Sunday brunch I had heard so much about and was blown away.  First of all, who KNEW that the inside of that dumpy little strip mall could be transformed into such a cool space?! I am a believer! There was a good 10-15 people waiting for tables, but the woman at the front said that we could eat at the bar if we wanted and we headed straight there ~ I like to be as close to the beer as possible anyways.  Trip 1 to the buffet made me go "hmmm, innnnteresting". House made mozzarella with pesto and tomatoes, fresh greens with lemon dill dressing, sweet potato hash, braised cabbage and kielbasa, beef brisket, a roasted  vegetable medley, Swedish meatballs, a beet dish, a ham salad dish, and some potatoes au gratin with a ton of breads, muffins and pastries to choose from as well.  I got a bite of everything and was really impressed with the veggie medley, sweet potato hash, lemon dill dressing, braised cabbage, and the house made mozz. All of it was just so fresh and inviting, or warm and comforting with a heavy helping of "so much better than i could do this at home" - the other dishes were good too, sans the Swedish meatballs which I thought didn't have a distinct taste to them.  At the bar, our bartender was SLAMMED but remained friendly and attentive. She let us know we could order some a la carte breakfast items included in the buffet from her so I tried some scrambled eggs (delish, and enough came out for 2!) and my amigo tried the french toast (HUGE bread, and soooo moist!). At the end of our great meal, we got some of the fresh fruit they had out (all was ripe and delish) and we ordered the chocolate waffles. CHOCOLATE WAFFLES. Listen, I don't even LIKE waffles, but holllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllly breakfast, Batman! These were sinful, amazing and the perfect end to a really excellent experience.  I'll def be coming back here soon, especially since it's so close to mi casa! :D

This bistro was plucked right out of the 3rd Arrondissement in Paris and nestled into one of charlotte's most hip areas.    The tapas spans classic French dishes to Mediterranean.   You can't go wrong either lavender chicken,  sautéed duck breast, or the lamb chops.  In fact you'll struggle with the options their small plates offer.    With an impressive wine selection, Bistro le Bon is both well-rounded and unpretentious destination for Charlotte foodies.

This is a great place to grab a drink and have a few appetizers!  I've eaten here about 6 times, and haven't had anything yet on their small plates/tapas menu that I didn't like.  Not my favorite place in the world for brunch, but still a solid foodie destination overall!

I couldn't imagine one chef could get everything so perfect from the Middle Eastern to Italian but he has done just that. (I should be an expert on the topic of mediterian food being half Italian, half Lebanese and having an Egyptian born mother.)  The atmosphere, and service is great and you wont believe the price once you taste how amazing the food is!  This place is one of my top 5 favorites in Charlotte.

Food was super average.  Mussels were good but sauce was terrible on its own.  Couldn't enjoy the dunking of the bread to sop up the sauce unfortunately. Duck was so charred and dry had to be sent back.  Also the whole duck dish was not balanced in flavor.  What wasn't overcooked was so sweet.  The rice was sweet, the sauce was sweet, the Brussel sprouts were sweet.  I Couldn't understand the price points either. The service was good though.
We went for our wedding anniversary.  We had a great time and an excellent meal.  We love this place!

Brunch was amazing! I had the shrimp and grits with a side of bacon. There was no wait but we did go on a Saturday. The service and ambiance of Bistro La Bon was great. I would love to come back to try dinner and the brunch buffet!

My boyfriend and I visited for Charlotte Restaurant week.  We frequented other restaurants in the area but never went here for whatever reason.  I'll break things down as best I can.  Food:  I opted for the farm lettuce salad (1st course), the trio tapenade  (2nd course), the saffron risotto (3rd course), and the flourless chocolate cake (4th course).  The salad was okay--I don't like balsamic vinegar, but Bistro can't be faulted for that.  If you like it, you'll probably like the salad.  The trio tapenade was tasty--it came with cannellini beans for one dipping option, guacamole, and roasted eggplant.  It was quite good--the pita crisps were a welcome change as opposed to the normal pita bread you usually get.  The saffron risotto was bright, colorful and had some robust flavors.  I wasn't expecting it to be that good because it didn't smell that great (you eat with your nose, too ya know), but after three careful  forkfuls, I decided that I had picked the right choice.  I'll definitely have it again.  For dessert, the flourless cake was really good.  That was my first flourless cake ever.  It was accompanied by a mango sorbet, which didn't make much since on the plate.  It came dusted with some type of brown sugar sprinkle, which also made no sense texturally when paired with the sweet and smooth sorbet.  All in all, I'd visit this place again and see what other vegetarian options they have.  Location:  You really can't go wrong with Plaza Midwood.  It's turned into a cultural hot spot and has shed its past reputation for being a seedy and somewhat dangerous place.  It's a great place to visit now and live if you're interested.  The one thing I don't like about Bistro is its attachment to a dilapidated plaza.  Although it occupies the corner, its doing itself a disservice by being located there.  Service:  Umm....it wasn't the best. Our server brought out the courses in the wrong order and seemed new.  She didn't really exude the confidence you expect in a good server.  She was pleasant, she smiled when greeting us, but all in all it could have been better.  Summation:  Go check this place out.  If you're into some decent food a fairly decent price, I think you'll like this place.

There's not much I can say that hasn't been said. Awesome service, awesome food, great atmosphere, tons of charm. Great for Tapas (small plates) and high quality entrees! This place is great for dates, groups, or even by yourself.

Urban? Trendy? Delicious? Yep...! This place is great for a casual Friday night w friends or a romantic dinner. Amazing dishes that are complex without being overly complicated... And the drink menu is impressive too.  #awesomeness #yummy

I was impressed immediately with the friendliness of the staff and great decor.  I had the Pyttipanna for Saturday brunch, which was the first time I'd ever seen that on a menu, and it was delicious.  Definitely a five star experience.

Bistro La Bon has become one of my favorite places to eat. At first, I thought the strip mall location to be odd, but once you're inside you forget about the wig store next door.  The food is excellent and have only been slightly disappointed once. That's pretty good given that I've eaten there at least a dozen times. They have obviously made a big commitment to make it work. Overall the service is great. The food is great and they work hard to satisfy!  Good job Bistro La Bon....

Went back to Bistro La Bon today with my girlfriend, and it was somehow as wonderful this time around as the last. We started with the pastry platter, which was incredible! Unfortunately we missed out on the Macaroons, as they hadn't been baked yet - but everything on the platter more than compensated for that.  Both of our dishes were great! Cooked perfectly, presented well, and most importantly delicious. Our waitress was prompt, funny, polite, and helpful.   This is the best location for brunch in Charlotte, hands down.

B for effort, Bistro la Bon. I enjoyed your atmosphere, and your wine selection, don't get me wrong.  For me and my friend, dinner came out to $63. For hummus, 2 veggie risotto (terrible, terrible veggie risotto), and a napoleon for dessert.  When a restaurant has the guts to charge me $15 for rice with a few pieces of onion, brussel sprouts and beet-- they better be ready to get hit with a real critique. The appeal of the vegetable risotto was that it had "hints" of truffle oil. Hints are nice-- presenting a basic aroma while not overpowering the dish with oil and truffle. All of the veggies were almost greasy they were doused in so much truffle oil. The risotto wasn't cooked correctly-- the texture was cooked a pinch under al dente. I personally don't like my risotto even at al dente, but I know thats a personal opinion.  The hummus was decent but instead of homemade pita, it was served with pieces of this flaky, greasy pie crust-tasting stuff. Two-for-two: greasy food.  Lastly! The saving grace of the meal: the passion fruit napoleon. The layout was gorgeous and the texture was spot-on. The only negative was the overly bitter taste of the passion fruit cream. Made me and my date pucker (and I love sour things).  Sorry Bistro La Bon, at least you made quite a bit of money off of my meal.

Phenomenal dinner! We ordered several small plates and all of them were delicious. We started with one of the specials (tuna hamachi),  frito misto, and crispy avocado and asparagus. Then had the Brie brûlée - OMG yum (fav)!!! After that, lavender chicken and the potato gnocchi. Finished with a bread pudding. - all was fantastic!! We will definitely be back. Highly recommend.

Wow! Where do I begin. We had brunch here on Sunday and I LOVED it! The staff was amazing! Our server was very attentive and we were never left wondering where he was despite the place being packed. The buffet had tons off things to choose from and they also bring out chocolate waffles, French toast, eggs/bacon and eggs Benedict at your request as part of the buffet price. I also loved all the traditional southern dishes they had choose from like cheesy grits, biscuits with gravy and more! We will for sure be back!

This place is phenomenal. I wanted to stop by before my flight out of Charlotte and I enjoyed the mussels and french fries. The service was amazing and the food matched as well. I would love to eat here for breakfast or dinner if I am in the area again.

Sunday Funday calls for Brunch darlings!  I've had Bistro La Bon bookmarked for a few months now.  I made my first reservation for two, then a made another reservation while eating hahaha!!! A week later I came back with two more friends, everything was delightful!   So clearly, I loved everything about this place!  Bistro La Bon is located in the Plaza Midwood area, across the street from Midwood Smokehouse! Another restaurant I need to visit!! There's plenty of parking available.   The menu offers ten brunch entrees to choose from. Thus far I've had the French Toast, Crab Omelet, and Asiago Grits!! All great selections in my opinion. Just a side note the Asiago Grits are large enough to share between two people. My favorite item so far is the Crab Omlete, which comes with actual claw meat, not imitation crab.  I added their signature Bearnaise Sauce and a side of Asiago Grits to my order. They also offer $3 Mimosas, Bellini's and $5 Bloody Marys.   I can't wait to come back for dinner. I hear the menu is delightful!

Their brunch is fresh and so good! Their decor and atmosphere make it an enjoyable 'upscale' place without super high prices. The owner is so nice and takes pride in his restaurant. Defiantly somewhere to try!

Visited Bistro for a quick and casual breakfast on a Saturday morning after seeing the great reviews on Yelp.  As an out-of-towner and total foodie, I thought I might have landed on something amazing. The pictures looked great, there were rave reviews, should've been an easy win!  I ordered the french toast - but, it was a bit burnt on the edges. Not like caramelized burnt, just burnt. And, nothing really special about it to be honest. However, the bacon was phenomenal.   I wouldn't recommend the french toast nor order it again. Next time I would order probably a classic breakfast (the people next to me had this and it looked awesome). Friendly staff and nice looking place, but waiting to be wowed by the food.

Had the Sunday brunch. Cute decor. Great deal if you're someone who's able to take advantage of the buffet ($22). The French toast was amazing. Great breakfast and lunch options in the buffet, some things lacked flavor (potato au gratin, grits). Fair amount of vegetarian options. Jalapeno Mac n cheese was great. Really good desserts/fruits as well. Only lame thing is they charge for all drinks, even coffee. That should be included in a buffet Brunch.

Whenever my friends visit Charlotte, I bring them to Bistra La Bon for a sunday brunch. The food is delicious, absolutely delicious! They have open buffet on sundays and they also bring items from the kitchen such as eggs benedict, french toast, waffles from the kitchen. Make sure you come here hungry! :) Also, I really like their interior decor which makes this whole experience even better.

This is probably one of the better options for Queen's Feast with four courses for $30. They only had the Queen's Feast menu and not their normal menu which was a good way to try their best stuff. The earliest reservation was for 8:45pm which was weird since the restaurant had plenty of tables open when we got there. Maybe they didn't have enough servers? I could tell that our server was particularly stressed since he was pretty much MIA most of the night and rolled his eyes when we asked for spoons to eat our soup. So I think they were short staffed. We tried to order different things to sample as much as we could so here is what we ordered:  First course - kale salad, beet salad, tomato basil soup  Second course - mussels, grilled octopus, lobster arancini  Third course - lavender chicken, Scottish salmon, pan seared scallops with creamy polenta ($6 supplement)  Fourth course - bread pudding and chocolate truffle  I would order the bread pudding every single time and the chicken with banana bread. Seriously these two things were some of the best dishes I've had in Charlotte so far.
Very good place, tapas style.  Bread pudding was amazing

Really let down by this place. All of the reviews led us to believe it was OMG THE BEST BRUNCH EVER and that is simply not the case. Very over priced for sub par food with poor service. Luckily, the manager was able to step in and save our overall view of the restaurant (good management goes a long way), so we may give it another go for dinner--but it's a no from us on brunch. Eggs were bland and nondescript. The biscuits and gravy were salty and grainy. I requested biscuits on their own and the waitress got caught up loving on her boyfriend and let them hang out under a heat lamp so long they came out hard as frisbees. I'd suggest going elsewhere for brunch--there are plenty of better options in CLT.

We heard great things on here about Bistro La Bon and decided to go here for Valentine's Day. It was a huge disappointment. The food was okay at best but way overpriced. The saffron rice was over spiced and only luke warm. The atmosphere was nice but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. You could get better food for half the price somewhere else.

From the outside Bistro La Bon looks like a small place but upon entering, you see the outside appearance is deceiving.  This is actually a decent sized restaurant with plenty of seating, a bar and a classy lounge area.    It is nicely decorated with local art on the walls.  The tables and chairs are of various styles which compliment each other very well.  The only downside is the music is a little loud that you can hardly hear your server explain the specials.   The menu is brief,  There are a few appetizers, salads and entrees on the menu that they have obviously mastered.  They also have daily specials.  Today I ventured into the land of beef and filet mignon.  It came accompanied with a russet potato and sweet potato gratin, seasoned pear, and green beans in a savory sauce.   The meal was nicely balanced - nothing was very heavy.  The meat was perfectly cooked medium rare as I requested and tender and flavorful.  The scallop appetizer was also delicious although we couldn't figure out what the scallops were laying on.    For dessert, I had a special which consisted of half a peach sitting in a light pastry with a lightly sweet sauce and dollop of vanilla ice cream.  Again, the portion was not too heavy and just the right size.  This is another gem in Charlotte that everyone should experience at least once.  I think I could come here once a week!     The only criticism I have is that our waiter could not be heard very well, partly because he was looking elsewhere when explaining the menu items and specials but he was friendly and attentive along with the rest of the staff.

Overall, this is the best food I've had in Charlotte, which I know doesn't say much, but it's also some of the best food I've ever had, anywhere.   Atmosphere:  This place has an ever so slightly upscale appearance, but down to earth enough that you feel comfortable dressed down. Very open and airy. Classy enough for an anniversary date, comfortable enough for a casual dinner with friends.   Service:  We've had excellent service here. Slightly pushy with suggesting things, which is fine, just not my favorite style of service. Being vegetarian it's always a drag to hear the waitress rave on and on and suggest we try some braised venison or the pork chops that fall off the bone. Perhaps ask of any dietary restrictions before rambling on about something that sounds disgusting or is off limits to a patron.  Food:  This is the thing about the food: The flavors are complex in a perfect way. It's how you'd expect gourmet food to taste. There are layers of flavor that you can't place, but that all work well together and create some sort of symphony in your mouth. And this applies to everything, even the little apple pastries that look like they'd be boring are a surprise of complex flavors. Give everything a try, you'll likely be surprised. I truly admire chefs who can accomplish this.   Cost: It's expensive, no question. Brunch is $18/plate. It's not outrageous, especially considering the quality, but it's not something you're going to do every week or even every month. But it's absolutely worth it when you do.  Celebrity most likely to enjoy eating here:  Gordon Ramsey. I think it might be the only place in the world he wouldn't have a seizure over the quality of the food.   Half hour to live and I have to get my last meal here:  If you could just make bullets out of everything on the buffet and gun me down in the face, I'd die happy.

Pros: Nice brunch spot Strong mimosas for $3  Fresh buffet options  Cons: Limited protein options Slow service Food was just OK  No reservations Sunday   My friends and I went here on a Sunday afternoon looking for the cure to our hangovers. Upon walking in, there were plenty of empty tables since it was 1:30pm and they close at 2:30pm. We asked the hostess for a table of 3. She said give her 5 min but we ended up waiting for 15min so that one person could come out and clean a specific table, despite the many that were already open. That didn't really sit well with us...but once we were seated, we went straight to the buffet. The prices Pp are $22 on Sunday for unlimited brunch buffet. And I must say, the options are pretty solid for that price. There was smoked salmon lox, beef brisket, kielbasa and cabbage, cheese grits, mac and cheese, scalloped potatoes, biscuits and gravy, Swedish meatballs, a small salad and fruit bar, and a smorgasbord of desserts/pastries. In addition to the buffet options you can also order unlimited eggs, bacon, and French toast.   I found the French toast made to order to be the best dish! The eggs were too runny and the bacon was soggy. The bread pudding from the pastry bar was also delicious. I wasn't too impressed with the flavors in other dishes, or the protein options. I guess I was expecting and omelette station or some type of chicken...I found the buffet to hold a little too many carbs!!!   I would probably come back here for brunch, but not without exploring other options in Charlotte first.

An update- we have been going to La Bon for years now. IT ONLY KEEPS GETTING BETTER. How is that possible? Friend them on FB- they always have events going on.  The brunch is obviously a huge favorite. It overwhelms me. I won't lie- I'm not a big buffet person. I end up binging on EVERYTHING. I feel ill and guilty after it. These are my own issues. No one else seems to mind- it is always busy for brunch (THEY ALSO HAVE A SATURDAY BREAKFAST- hard to find). Apparently, there is a lunch buffet now. I might check that out after summer.  Recommendation: just sit at the bar area. You don't need to go into the restaurant. The bar area is nice because you can laugh loudly without feeling like you are interrupting a date. They always have some sort of drink special. The small plates are really good- especially the asparagus. The bread pudding is delicious. Really, everything is good.  I don't normally like to have dinners with more than 4 people (6 tops). This is one of the few restaurants that I have had a large dinner with successfully. That is a skill.  I love that La Bon gives back to the community.

It is Charlotte Restaurant Week and my sister chose this place based on the menu. We got a 5:30 reservation for our party of four and were seated quickly. Nice atmosphere. There are tables outside that promise fun dining when the weather is better. Course one: beet salad. Very good. Course two: mussels. Fantastic! A bit of zing to the sauce. Course three: Swedish meatballs. Beautifully presented, but nothing special in terms of flavor. Course four: bread pudding. Very good but more like French toast than any bread pudding I have ever had. Now we come to the more negative part of the review. We finished at 9 pm. Yes, 5:30 to 9 pm. The intervals between courses were very long. The course were delivered by people other than our server, whom we rarely saw. The place was full. However, there appeared to be plenty of staff so I suspect it was the kitchen that was having trouble keeping up. The food was good enough that I'd be willing to try it again, but the slow service was a definite negative and came close to spoiling the evening.

Had not been here in a while to eat.  We came after work to check it out.  They've completely changed the bar area and there is no longer a TV.  I think I liked it the other way better, but this way gives much more open space and bar area seating including the bar itself, plenty of high-tops and lounge seating - overall a winning combination.  They also play some chill music, which I like.  There is patio/outdoor dining as well as it is very comfortable and spacious, although seating is limited.  We sat at the bar to have some appetizers and the bartender/server for us was Kevin. He is a new bartender, but he was very personable, helpful and informative but still allowed us our privacy.  We had the Calamari with a smoky, chunky tomato sauce.  It was very good with sun-dried tomatoes reduced to provide a nice toothsome sauce with a slight sweetness from the tomatoes!  Calamari with rings and tentacles - crispy and perfectly cooked, not rubbery at all.  We also had the seared gnocchi with parmesan pepper sauce...slightly salty to me, but absolutely delicious with chunks of artichoke that were cooked well so you didn't have any hard parts.  We finished our appetizer selection with the scallops.  Two seared scallops (a little under to my taste) and a dollop of delicious pureed potato with a brown sauce.  Very, very good.  We ended the evening with the Brioche Bread Pudding with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream.  I think this is the best bread pudding in town.  The chef, Majhid (not sure if I'm spelling this right and I didn't get his last name) came to check on us and he was very friendly and interested in our feedback.  Reasonable pricing for Charlotte.  Not crazy like some places.  They have a Saturday brunch which is more traditional fare and the Sunday brunch which is more of a European-style brunch with cheeses, meatballs and other assorted goodies.  I think they've made some great updates here and I look forward to going back soon!

Amazing brunch, excellent staff. Been here a few times and they clearly take pride in what they do. The whole waitstaff acts like they own the place, in the best way possible. Bring your appetite if you're doing brunch and you'll eat like a king for $20. Come early - they don't take reservations. And for God's sake, try a mini-lemon tart and a chocolate waffle (which is not as intensely sweet as you might think), because they're absolute heaven.

I cannot say enough about this place. Favorite restaurant in Charlotte hands down. The food and the service are second to none, and the atmosphere is perfect for all occasions.  From cocktails to tapas, vegetarian friendly cuisine and amazing steaks, you really cannot go wrong.

My boyfriend and I went here on a Friday night. We made reservations but didn't really need them. It was very busy inside. We ordered some pretty cool drinks. I got the jalapeño basil martini - it's a little spicy!  We tried a few bar bites and a couple small plates. The burger is a must have! So delicious. The scallops are fantastic and the octopus is so amazing.

First time trying, Service adequate & friendly. Mussels sauce amazing... Made up for the 4-5 empty shells and very small but tender mussels.  Misto Frito- good breading, sauce to salty (maybe the olives) and quickly turned to mushy food in the sauce. Jamon & truffle grilled cheese had a great crunchy (non greasy) bread. But was lacking jamon flavor, it comes from the the thinly sliced shank.  They need to add another slice to the sandwich. Everything was good, but the mussels sauce was the bomb diggity!  2 best I've ever had!!  Can't wait to try the Sunday Brunch!!  I'm sure the quality of food will be good for a buffet.

This was my first time going to this place and at first I was impressed with the ambiance of the restaurant. This place is a bit pricey and the portions are that of fine dining. If you want to spend money on a appetizer looking dish as an entree then this is your place, but I would not recommend this for vegetarians or to those who would not be impressed with a slab of cheese and five goat cheese stuffed baby peppers. In my opinion, I'd stick to the bar for drinks and get bar bites, unless you are a carnivore then this might be what you've been looking for...just bring enough money. I have heard amazing things about their brunch, but after this experience I'm not keen on coming back here.

Cookie was here...  ... for dessert and coffee for two. About $20, including tip.  They have a new pumpkin creme brulee on the menu. Yum.  Four stars for the total experience, which included the great service from our waiter and a manager.

Such a shame! The food was delicious but the experience was terrible. Our friends made reservations during restaurant week. The reservations were for 9:00pm and we were sat over 40 minutes after arriving on time for the reservation. Nothing bothers me more than a restaurant not honoring a reservation.
